analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon shes pa'o //
translated: The mind is the knowledge of the benefits of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: des ni mi zhum pa'i brtson 'grus kyi sgo nas sgyid lug pa'i stobs gzhom pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mi zhum pa'i brtson 'grus kyi sgo nas sgyid lug pa'i stobs gzhom pa bstan to //
translated: By this he has shown the conquest of the power of discouragement by means of the effort which does not become fainthearted.

original: de bas na sems can gyi don bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi don bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to show the accomplishment of the aims of sentient beings, he says: For the sake of sentient beings, etc.

original: go cha dang / sbyor ba dang / mi ldog pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi sgo nas snyom las kyi stobs gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: go cha dang / sbyor ba dang / mi ldog pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus kyi sgo nas snyom las kyi stobs gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the conquest of the power of laziness by means of the effort which is armored, applied, not turning back, and not satisfied, he says: For the sake of sentient beings, etc.

original: sems can don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rkang pa gnyis kyis dpung rnam pa bzhi bskyed pa bstan te /
analyzed: sems can don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rkang pa gnyis kyis dpung rnam pa bzhi bskyed pa bstan te /
translated: The two lines beginning For the sake of sentient beings show the generation of the fourfold army.

original: tshigs su bcad pa sdebs pa'i dbang gis 'di ltar gsungs kyang /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa sdebs pa'i dbang gis 'di ltar gsungs kyang /
translated: Although it is stated in this way because of the power of the metrical arrangement,

original: don gyi dbang gis 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: it is to be applied in this way because of the power of the meaning.

original: cho ga'i brtson 'grus te mos pa'i dpung bskyed pa dang / sbyor ba ste rigs pa'i dpung dang / mi ldog pa ste brtan pa'i dpung dang / @329b chog par mi 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: cho ga'i brtson 'grus te mos pa'i dpung bskyed pa dang / sbyor ba ste rigs pa'i dpung dang / mi ldog pa ste brtan pa'i dpung dang / @329b chog par mi 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The effort of the rite, the generation of the army of devotion, the application, the army of reasoning, the non-retrogression, the army of stability, and the non-satisfaction, the generation of the army of joy.

original: dga' ba'i dpung bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba'i dpung bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: da ni rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, from the point of view of the extensive explanation,

original: mos dpung bskyed pa rkang pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: mos dpung bskyed pa rkang pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: the generation of the army of devotion is indicated by two lines.

original: dge ba'i las de ma byas pa'i nyes dmigs 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa dang / de byas pa'i phan yon bdag dang gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon la bsams pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i las de ma byas pa'i nyes dmigs 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa dang / de byas pa'i phan yon bdag dang gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon la bsams pas /
translated: Thinking of the disadvantage of not doing that virtuous action, the fear of the suffering of cyclic existence, and the benefit of doing it, the complete fulfillment of one's own and others' goals,

original: bdag gis dge ba'i chos bsgrub par bya'o snyam du sems la go gon pa'i mos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dpung bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gis dge ba'i chos bsgrub par bya'o snyam du sems la go gon pa'i mos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dpung bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should generate the army of the characteristic of devotion, the armor of the thought, I will accomplish virtuous dharmas. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: da ni de'i 'og tu sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni de'i 'og tu sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, after that, in order to take up the topic of the striving of application,

original: bya bar mi rigs pa las ldog cing bya bar rigs pa la sbyor bas rigs pa'i dpung bskyed par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya bar mi rigs pa las ldog cing bya bar rigs pa la sbyor bas rigs pa'i dpung bskyed par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the generation of the army of reason by turning away from what is not proper to do and by applying oneself to what is proper to do,

original: nyam nga che thang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyam nga che thang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Even if one is in a very dangerous situation,” and so on.

original: bya bar rigs pa ni bdag dang gzhan du brdze bar 'gyur ba yin la log par ni bya bar mi rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya bar rigs pa ni bdag dang gzhan du brdze bar 'gyur ba yin la log par ni bya bar mi rigs pa yin no //
translated: What is proper to do is to exchange oneself for others, and what is not proper to do is to do the opposite.

original: de ltar bya bar rigs pa la sbyor ba'i tshe brtsams pa'i 'phro mi gcod pas mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: de ltar bya bar rigs pa la sbyor ba'i tshe brtsams pa'i 'phro mi gcod pas mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: When one applies oneself in this way to what is proper to do, one’s striving is irreversible, since one does not interrupt the continuity of one’s undertaking.

original: brten pa'i dpung bskyed pa'i dbang du byas nas nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brten pa'i dpung bskyed pa'i dbang du byas nas nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to take up the topic of the generation of the army of steadfastness, he says, “Even if one is afflicted by the afflictions,” and so on.

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur na bya bar rigs pa las ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur na bya bar rigs pa las ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: By what is meant is that one turns away from what is proper to do because one has come under the influence of the afflictions.

original: gang du nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen dang lhan cig gnas pa'i dus na gnyen po sna tshogs kyis nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi gtong zhing /
analyzed: gang du nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen dang lhan cig gnas pa'i dus na gnyen po sna tshogs kyis nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi gtong zhing /
translated: When the conditions for the arising of afflictions are present, at that time, do not fall under the power of the afflictions through various antidotes.

original: bya bar rigs pa'i las las mi ldog par brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya bar rigs pa'i las las mi ldog par brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should be firm, not turning away from the activities that are suitable to be done.

original: yang nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi don yin te /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi don yin te /
translated: Moreover, “afflictions” means suffering.

original: bdag nyid dge ba'i las la zhugs pa'i tshe bya dka' ba'i sdug bsngal ji snyed byung yang gnyen po sna tshogs kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal de dag gis ji mi snyam par bya zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid dge ba'i las la zhugs pa'i tshe bya dka' ba'i sdug bsngal ji snyed byung yang gnyen po sna tshogs kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal de dag gis ji mi snyam par bya zhing /
translated: When one is engaged in virtuous activities, no matter how much suffering arises that is difficult to do, one should not be bothered by those sufferings through various antidotes.

original: las de la mi ldog par brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽da ni bya bar rigs pa'i las ji snyed byas kyang /
analyzed: las de la mi ldog par brtan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // da ni bya bar rigs pa'i las ji snyed byas kyang /
translated: The meaning is that one should be firm, not turning away from that activity.

original: des chog par mi 'dzin par yang nas yang du byed 'dod pa'i dga' ba'i dpung bskyed par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des chog par mi 'dzin par yang nas yang du byed 'dod pa'i dga' ba'i dpung bskyed par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the generation of the army of delight that desires to do again and again without being satisfied with however much one has done that is suitable to be done,🔽it says:

original: rtsed mo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtsed mo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word “play” is mentioned.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar bya snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it done in that way?

original: bde ba'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde ba'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase “for the sake of pleasure” and so on is mentioned.

original: yang 'jig rten dag na las gang zhig byas pas 'dod pa'i bde ba 'grub pa'i nges pa med pa la yang 'grub @330a * //
analyzed: yang 'jig rten dag na las gang zhig byas pas 'dod pa'i bde ba 'grub pa'i nges pa med pa la yang 'grub @330a * //
translated: Moreover, in the world, there is no certainty that the performance of any action will result in the attainment of the pleasure of sensual desire.

original: par srid pa tsam gyi sgo nas kyang /
analyzed: par srid pa tsam gyi sgo nas kyang /
translated: However, even on the basis of the mere possibility of attaining🔽that pleasure,

original: yang nas yang du brtson 'grus rtsom par byed na /
analyzed: yang nas yang du brtson 'grus rtsom par byed na /
translated: one repeatedly exerts effort.

original: gdon mi za bar 'dod pa'i bde ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i las la yang nas yang du brtson 'grus brtsams na 'dod pa'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'dod pa'i bde ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i las la yang nas yang du brtson 'grus brtsams na 'dod pa'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir /
translated: If one repeatedly exerts effort in regard to an action that will certainly result in the attainment of the pleasure of sensual desire, then in order to attain the pleasure of sensual desire,

original: yang nas yang du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang nas yang du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should repeatedly exert effort. This is the meaning.

original: yang las su bya ba 'ga' zhig gis ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa skyed kyang /
analyzed: yang las su bya ba 'ga' zhig gis ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa skyed kyang /
translated: Moreover, even though some action may produce immeasurable future suffering,

original: 'phral gyi bde ba tsam la bltas nas des ngoms par mi byed /
analyzed: 'phral gyi bde ba tsam la bltas nas des ngoms par mi byed /
translated: one does not become satisfied by merely looking at the immediate pleasure.

original: thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba skyed par byed pa'i dge ba'i las kyis lha shin tu yang ngoms par mi bya ste ;
analyzed: thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba skyed par byed pa'i dge ba'i las kyis lha shin tu yang ngoms par mi bya ste ;
translated: One should not be satisfied with the virtuous karma that generates benefit and happiness for all,

original: yang nas yang du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang nas yang du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but one should repeatedly apply oneself with diligence.

original: spu gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spu gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach this, he says, “like a razor’s edge,” and so forth.

original: rnam smin bde la zhi ba yi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam smin bde la zhi ba yi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pleasant ripening and peace.

original: bde ba ni tshe 'di'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni tshe 'di'o //
translated: Here, “pleasant” is in this life.

original: zhi ba ni tshe phyi ma'i'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni tshe phyi ma'i'o //
translated: “Peace” is in the next life.

original: yang na bde ba ni mtho ris kyi'o //
analyzed: yang na bde ba ni mtho ris kyi'o //
translated: Alternatively, “pleasant” is in the higher realms.

original: zhi ba ni thar pa'i'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni thar pa'i'o //
translated: “Peace” is liberation.

original: yang na bde ba ni tshe phyi ma'i'o //
analyzed: yang na bde ba ni tshe phyi ma'i'o //
translated: Alternatively, “pleasant” is in the next life.

original: zhi ba ni tshe 'di'i ste /
analyzed: zhi ba ni tshe 'di'i ste /
translated: “Peace” is in this life,

original: nyon mongs pa dang las de nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las de nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pacifies the afflictions and karma that are incompatible with that.

original: yang na bde ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: yang na bde ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: Alternatively, “pleasant” is for the benefit of others.

original: zhi ba ni rang gi don to //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rang gi don to //
translated: “Peace” is for one’s own benefit.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud do //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud do //
translated: “Thus,” and so forth, concludes the chapter.

original: 'o na mi dge ba'i las la yang chog par mi 'dzin par dga' ba'i dpung bskyed par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi dge ba'i las la yang chog par mi 'dzin par dga' ba'i dpung bskyed par bya'am zhe na /
translated: Now, should one not also not be satisfied with nonvirtuous karma, but generate the army of joy?

original: ma yin te /🔽mi dge ba'i las la ni lhan cig rjes su spyod pa'i shes bzhin gyis byed pa'i mod la tshor bar 'gyur na phyis byed par 'dod pa'i bsam pa spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir rjes su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma yin te / mi dge ba'i las la ni lhan cig rjes su spyod pa'i shes bzhin gyis byed pa'i mod la tshor bar 'gyur na phyis byed par 'dod pa'i bsam pa spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir rjes su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: No.🔽For nonvirtuous karma, one should be aware of the simultaneous action, and later abandon the intention to do it.

original: da ni mi dge ba'i las la mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa'i mtshon brjed nges pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa'i dbang du mi gtong zhing dran pa dang shes bzhin la gnas te /
analyzed: da ni mi dge ba'i las la mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa'i mtshon brjed nges pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa'i dbang du mi gtong zhing dran pa dang shes bzhin la gnas te /
translated: Now, in order to show that one should not forget the weapon of the afflictions, the cause of delighting in nonvirtuous karma, and should not be carried away by lack of awareness, but should abide in mindfulness and awareness,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and abandon the afflictions,

original: 'thab rnying zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'thab rnying zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says “the old enemy,” and so on.

original: dran pa nyams par 'gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa nyams par 'gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If mindfulness declines, what should one do?

original: g-yul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: g-yul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says “in battle,” and so on.

original: dang po nyid nas kyang mi 'tshor bar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas kyang mi 'tshor bar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that one should not be negligent from the very beginning,

original: yungs mar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yungs mar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “like a mustard seed in a needle’s eye.”

original: dran pa zhes bya ba mi mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi shes bzhin la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba mi mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi shes bzhin la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: “ Mindfulness” is merely an illustration; one should understand that it is also vigilance.

original: gal te de ltar @330b 'bad kyang ras 'ga' ltung ba byung na ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar @330b 'bad kyang ras 'ga' ltung ba byung na ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
translated: If one should ask, “What if, even though one has made such an effort, a downfall occurs?”

original: nyes pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nyes pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If a downfall should occur,” and so on.

original: dge bshes phrad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni /🔽gal te 'di snyam du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa la sogs pa la brten te /
analyzed: dge bshes phrad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni / gal te 'di snyam du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa la sogs pa la brten te /
translated: The meaning of “meeting a spiritual teacher,” and so on, is as follows.

original: dus thams cad du dran pa dang mi 'bral bar bya snyam na de'i tshe de la thabs ji ltar bya snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du dran pa dang mi 'bral bar bya snyam na de'i tshe de la thabs ji ltar bya snyam pa yin no //
translated: If one thinks, “I will rely on meeting a spiritual teacher, and so on, and will not be separated from mindfulness at any time,” then at that time one should think, “What is the method for that?”

original: des na gdams ngag mi brjed par bya zhing bdag nyid kyi lus sems kyi so glod de ha cang yang bsgrim pa ma yin par byas la /
analyzed: des na gdams ngag mi brjed par bya zhing bdag nyid kyi lus sems kyi so glod de ha cang yang bsgrim pa ma yin par byas la /
translated: Therefore, one should not forget the instructions, and one should relax one’s body and mind, and not be too tense.

original: las la ma zhugs pa'i gong rol nas bya ba thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba'i bshes bzhin la gnas par byas na /
analyzed: las la ma zhugs pa'i gong rol nas bya ba thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba'i bshes bzhin la gnas par byas na /
translated: If one remains in the state of a friend, which is the beginning of all actions, prior to engaging in action,

original: de'i tshe dus thams cad du mi 'bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe dus thams cad du mi 'bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i phyir /
translated: then at that time one will be inseparable from it at all times.

original: bag yod gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bag yod gtam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, he says, “The story of heedfulness,” and so on.

original: de ltar ma byas na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
translated: If one does not do it in that way, what is the fault?

original: ji ltar khrag la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar khrag la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, he says, “Just as if one were to cut flesh from one’s own body,” and so on.

original: da ni dpung rnam pa bzhi la gnas te /
analyzed: da ni dpung rnam pa bzhi la gnas te /
translated: Now, having relied on the fourfold army,

original: snyom las kyi stobs gzhom par bya ba mjug bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snyom las kyi stobs gzhom par bya ba mjug bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the conclusion of the conquest of the power of laziness,

original: de bas pang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas pang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Therefore, one should be diligent,” and so on.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhom par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhom par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the conquest of the opposing side,

original: da ni brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: now, from the perspective of the nature of effort,

original: bdag nyid la dge ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid la dge ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa ni /
translated: the perfection of virtuous qualities in oneself,

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa lnga'i dbang du gyur pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa lnga'i dbang du gyur pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one accomplishes the transcendences through the power of the five kinds of effort, he says:

original: ji ltar shing bal  zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar shing bal  zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Just as cotton is carried by the wind,🔽so the bodhisattva is carried by the power of effort.

original: mos pa'i dbang du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: mos pa'i dbang du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The power of aspiration is merely an illustration;

original: de bzhin du mi zhum pa'i dbang du gyur pa dang / rigs pa'i dbang du gyur pa dang / brtan pa'i dbang du gyur pa dang / dga' ba'i dbang du gyur pas zhes bya ba de ltar yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi zhum pa'i dbang du gyur pa dang / rigs pa'i dbang du gyur pa dang / brtan pa'i dbang du gyur pa dang / dga' ba'i dbang du gyur pas zhes bya ba de ltar yang shes par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that the power of non-discouragement, the power of wisdom, the power of steadfastness, and the power of delight are also like that.

original: da ni gang gi don du brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni gang gi don du brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the purpose of the practice of effort, he says:

original: 'di snyam du nyan thos la sogs pa dag kyang de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di snyam du nyan thos la sogs pa dag kyang de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom pa ma yin nam /
translated: Do not the sravakas, etc. also practice effort in this way?

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus 'di gang gis khyad par du 'phags snyam pa'i sgo nas bsdus nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus 'di gang gis khyad par du 'phags snyam pa'i sgo nas bsdus nas /
translated: At that time, how is the bodhisattva's effort superior?

original: de dag de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom mod kyi /
translated: Although they practice effort in this way,

original: de dag ni bdag gcig pu dul bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom gyi bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag gcig pu dul bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom gyi bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom pa ma yin la /
translated: They strive at effort for the sake of taming just themselves, but they do not strive at effort for the sake of equalizing themselves and others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i don du @331a * //🔽brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pas /🔽de ltar na nyan thos la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus pas byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus dgos pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i don du @331a * // brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pas / de ltar na nyan thos la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus pas byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus dgos pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Bodhisattvas strive at effort for the sake of equalizing themselves and others.

original: khyad par du 'phags par bstan par bya'o snyam du slob dpon gyi thugs la gzhag nas /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags par bstan par bya'o snyam du slob dpon gyi thugs la gzhag nas /
translated: Thus, the master thinks, “I will teach how the bodhisattvas’ effort is superior to the effort of the hearers and so on in terms of its purpose.”

original: lag pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: With this in mind, he says, “Their arms and so on,” and so forth.

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa gzhan dag na re /
translated: Here, other commentators say:

original: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa dang // zhes bya ba dang / bdag dang gzhan du brje ba zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa dang // zhes bya ba dang / bdag dang gzhan du brje ba zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: “Equalizing self and other” and “exchanging self and other”

original: slob dpon gyis skabs 'dir bshad kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis skabs 'dir bshad kyang /
translated: are explained by the master in this context,🔽but they are not the meaning of the root text.

original: 'dir ni bsam pa dang shes rab kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir bshad pa'i rigs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsam pa dang shes rab kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir bshad pa'i rigs pa ma yin pas /
translated: But since this is included in the thought and wisdom, it is not appropriate to explain it here.

original: le'u 'og mar bshad par bya'o zhes /
analyzed: le'u 'og mar bshad par bya'o zhes /
translated: It will be explained in the next chapter.

original: slob dpon la skyon rjod par byed pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: slob dpon la skyon rjod par byed pa de dag gis ni /
translated: Those who find fault with the master

original: slob dgon gyi dgongs pa ma shes par mthong ste /
analyzed: slob dgon gyi dgongs pa ma shes par mthong ste /
translated: are seen to not understand the thought of the master.

original: gal te don gnyis po 'dir ma bshad na /
analyzed: gal te don gnyis po 'dir ma bshad na /
translated: If these two topics are not explained here,

original: dus de'i rgol ba de la lan ji ltar gdab cing /
analyzed: dus de'i rgol ba de la lan ji ltar gdab cing /
translated: how would one respond to the opponent at that time?

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus las byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus rgyu gang gis khyad par du 'phags te de'i khyad par ma bstan pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i brtson 'grus las byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus rgyu gang gis khyad par du 'phags te de'i khyad par ma bstan pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: By what cause is the bodhisattva's effort superior to the effort of śrāvakas and so on? Since that difference would not be taught,🔽the explanation of others is not very reasonable.

original: gzhan gyi bshad pa de ni shin tu rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bshad pa de ni shin tu rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis /
translated: Therefore, those who are wise

original: slob dpon nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa'i dgongs pa btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa'i dgongs pa btsal bar bya'o //
translated: should seek the thought of the master's explanation here.

original: slob dpon gyis dgongs pa mi tshol bar slob dpon blo gros mi zad pas 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi dngos grub brnyes pa'i bka' lung khyad du bsad nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis dgongs pa mi tshol bar slob dpon blo gros mi zad pas 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi dngos grub brnyes pa'i bka' lung khyad du bsad nas /
translated: The Master does not seek to understand the intention of the Master, but instead disregards the special transmission of the noble Manjusri, which was obtained by the Master Ak�ayamati.

original: so so skye bo rang dgar smra ba rnams kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ni shin tu rigs pa ma yin pas de ni thag bsrings te spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: so so skye bo rang dgar smra ba rnams kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ni shin tu rigs pa ma yin pas de ni thag bsrings te spang bar bya'o //
translated: It is not at all appropriate to follow the prattle of ordinary people, so one should avoid them from afar.

original: de bas na slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni gong du bshad pa lta bu yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni gong du bshad pa lta bu yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, I think that the intention of the Master is as explained above.

original: ci'i phyir bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom zhe na /🔽bdag nyid ltar bde ba 'dod la sdug bsngal mi 'dod pa bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom zhe na / bdag nyid ltar bde ba 'dod la sdug bsngal mi 'dod pa bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Why does one undertake the practice of the perfections in order to make oneself and others equal?🔽All sentient beings are just like oneself in wanting happiness and not wanting suffering.

original: de bas na bdag la ji ltar bde bas phan gdags shing sdug bsngal las bskyab pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang de bzhin du bya dgos te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag la ji ltar bde bas phan gdags shing sdug bsngal las bskyab pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang de bzhin du bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, just as one must benefit oneself with happiness and protect oneself from suffering, so one must do the same for all sentient beings.

original: dper na lus 'di nyid la lag pa la sogs pa nang tshan du dbye ba mang yang bde bas phan gdags shing gnod pa las @331b bsrung ba thams cad mtshungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lus 'di nyid la lag pa la sogs pa nang tshan du dbye ba mang yang bde bas phan gdags shing gnod pa las @331b bsrung ba thams cad mtshungs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in this very body, although there are many internal divisions such as the hands, all are the same in that they are to be benefited by happiness and protected from harm.

original: de bas na bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, “one should undertake striving in order to make oneself and others equal” means

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par bya ba'i don du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin par bya ba'i don du brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: that one should undertake striving in order to perfect the aims of oneself and others, reaching the highest point.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi sdug bsngal de bdag la mi 'bab pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi sdug bsngal de bdag la mi 'bab pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the suffering of others not incumbent on oneself?

original: ci'i phyir mi bzod de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi bzod de /
translated: Why is it not endured?

original: gsal bar snyam pa la /
analyzed: gsal bar snyam pa la /
translated: Thinking that it is clear,

original: de lta yin mod kyi rang gi nyams kyis te /
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi rang gi nyams kyis te /
translated: it is like that, but by one’s own experience.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal de gzhan la mi 'bab kyang rang gi lus la chags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal de gzhan la mi 'bab kyang rang gi lus la chags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Although one’s own suffering is not incumbent on another, it is because of attachment to one’s own body.

original: mi bzod pa'i nyams kyis so //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i nyams kyis so //
translated: It is by the experience of impatience.

original: de bas na bdag gi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “My suffering, etc.”

original: gal te de ltar nyams gcig pa yin du zin kyang phan tshun mi gnod pa nyid kyi phyir bsal bar mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nyams gcig pa yin du zin kyang phan tshun mi gnod pa nyid kyi phyir bsal bar mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If, although they are the same in being painful, they are not to be removed because they do not harm each other,

original: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: then they are the same in being suffering by nature.

original: de bas na bdag gis gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “The suffering of others, etc.”

original: ci'i phyir bdag bzhin du gzhan la phan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag bzhin du gzhan la phan par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one benefit others as oneself?

original: gzhan de yang sems can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan de yang sems can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are sentient beings.

original: de bas na bdag gi gzhan las zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi gzhan las zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “I am not different from others, etc.”

original: yang gzhan gyi don du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi don du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate the benefit of others,

original: gang gi tshe bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos te /
translated: he says two verses, beginning with “When I am the same as others, etc.”

original: 'dod pa mtshungs pa'i phyir gnyi ga mnyam pa nyid du bya dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa mtshungs pa'i phyir gnyi ga mnyam pa nyid du bya dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should make them equal because they are the same in wanting happiness.

original: gzhan yang gal te de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, if you say, “But that is not my suffering,”

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal de ni gzhan nyid la gnod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal de ni gzhan nyid la gnod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then since the suffering that exists in the continuum of another is the harm of that other person,

original: gzhan de nyid kyis bsrung bar rigs kyi bdag la mi gnod pa'i phyir bdag la bsrung bar mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan de nyid kyis bsrung bar rigs kyi bdag la mi gnod pa'i phyir bdag la bsrung bar mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: it is reasonable that it is protected by that other person. It is not reasonable that it is protected by you, because it does not harm you.

original: gal te de lta na ni tshe phyi ma ngan song du skye ba'i sdug bsngal de yang da ltar rang gi lus 'di nyid la mi gnod pa'i phyir lus 'dis sbyin pa gtong ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bsrung bar mi rigs so snyam nas /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni tshe phyi ma ngan song du skye ba'i sdug bsngal de yang da ltar rang gi lus 'di nyid la mi gnod pa'i phyir lus 'dis sbyin pa gtong ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bsrung bar mi rigs so snyam nas /
translated: If that is so, then it is not reasonable that this body should protect itself by giving gifts and so on, because the suffering of being born in a miserable realm in a future life does not harm this very body.

original: bdag gis de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag gis de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thinking this, he says, “But that is not my suffering.”

original: yang gang gi tshe gzhan gyi sdug bsngal de ni gzhan nyid kyis bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe gzhan gyi sdug bsngal de ni gzhan nyid kyis bsrung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, if the suffering of another is to be protected by that other person,

original: de'i tshe rkang pa'i sdug bsngal yang rkang pa nyid kyis bsrung bar bya'o /
analyzed: de'i tshe rkang pa'i sdug bsngal yang rkang pa nyid kyis bsrung bar bya'o /
translated: then the suffering of the foot should be protected by the foot itself.

original: lag pas bsrung bar mi rigs so snyam du bsam nas /
analyzed: lag pas bsrung bar mi rigs so snyam du bsam nas /
translated: It is not reasonable to protect the hand.

original: gang tshe gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽'on te ma 'ongs @332a * //🔽pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rkang pa'i sdug bsngal yang go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: gang tshe gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // 'on te ma 'ongs @332a * // pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rkang pa'i sdug bsngal yang go rims bzhin du /
translated: Thinking this, he says, “When, whose?”

original: tshe 'di'i lus dang / lag pas bsrung bar rigs te /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i lus dang / lag pas bsrung bar rigs te /
translated: But if it is the future suffering and the suffering of the foot, then it is reasonable to protect the body and the hand of this life,

original: rgyud dang tshogs gcig pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rgyud dang tshogs gcig pa'i phyir la /
translated: because they are the same continuum and the same collection.

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal de ni bdag dang rgyud dang tshogs pa mi gcig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal de ni bdag dang rgyud dang tshogs pa mi gcig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But that suffering of another is not the same continuum and the same collection as oneself.

original: rgyud dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyud dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The continuum,” and so on.

original: dper na phreng ba dang chu'i rgyud la rgyun can gyi dbang po dang gnyis pa dang / chu rgyun snga ma phyi ma la sogs pa so so tha dad pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: dper na phreng ba dang chu'i rgyud la rgyun can gyi dbang po dang gnyis pa dang / chu rgyun snga ma phyi ma la sogs pa so so tha dad pa nyid yin la /
translated: For example, in the case of a garland and a stream of water, the individual members of the continuum, the first and second moments of the water, and so on, are distinct.

original: de la ma gtogs pa'i rgyun can zhes bya ba gcig pa ni med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa'i rgyun can zhes bya ba gcig pa ni med pa bzhin du /
translated: But apart from them, there is no single entity called the continuum.

original: tshe phyi ma yang rgyud ni tshe snga phyi'i skye 'jig so so tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma yang rgyud ni tshe snga phyi'i skye 'jig so so tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Also, the continuum of life is the individual arising and ceasing of past and future lives.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gcig pa ni cung zad tsam yang med do //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gcig pa ni cung zad tsam yang med do //
translated: Apart from that, there is not the slightest thing called a continuum.

original: yang de bzhin du nags tshal gyi tshogs zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: yang de bzhin du nags tshal gyi tshogs zhes bya ba yang /
translated: In the same way, a forest is a collection of trees.

original: tshogs pa can ni dang ba dang kha da re sogs pa tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: tshogs pa can ni dang ba dang kha da re sogs pa tha dad pa yin la /
translated: The members of the collection are individual trees, such as pines and birches.

original: de las ma gtogs pa can zhes bya ba gcig pa med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa can zhes bya ba gcig pa med pa bzhin du /
translated: Apart from them, there is no such thing as a collection.

original: lus la yang tshogs pa can ni lag pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir so so tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: lus la yang tshogs pa can ni lag pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir so so tha dad pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, the members of the collection of the body are the hands and so on, which are individually different because they have different characteristics.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i lus kyi tshogs bya ba gcig pa nyid du gzhan pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i lus kyi tshogs bya ba gcig pa nyid du gzhan pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Apart from them, there is not the slightest thing called a collection of the body.

original: 'on te de lta yin na /
analyzed: 'on te de lta yin na /
translated: But if that is so,

original: tshe snga ma la sems can gyi rgyud ces bya ba dang lag pa la sogs pa lus kyi tshogs zhes bya bar gcig tu 'dzin par byed ce na /
analyzed: tshe snga ma la sems can gyi rgyud ces bya ba dang lag pa la sogs pa lus kyi tshogs zhes bya bar gcig tu 'dzin par byed ce na /
translated: why do we apprehend the continuum of sentient beings in a past life and the collection of the body, such as the hands, as being the same?

original: de ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis gcig tu 'dzin pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa'i dbang gis gcig tu 'dzin pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is grasped as one by the power of error.

original: da ni yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, having accepted this, it should be stated:

original: ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa lus kyi yan lag tu gcig pa'i phyir rkang pa'i don lag pas byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa lus kyi yan lag tu gcig pa'i phyir rkang pa'i don lag pas byed pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the hand and so on are one with the body because they are its parts, so the hand should perform the function of the foot.

original: sems can thams cad kyang 'gro ba'i yan lag tu gcig pa'i phyir bdag bzhin du gzhan gyi don yang bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang 'gro ba'i yan lag tu gcig pa'i phyir bdag bzhin du gzhan gyi don yang bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, since all sentient beings are one with the world because they are its parts, just as with oneself, one should also perform the welfare of others.

original: ji ltar lag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽yang na ji ltar sems can thams cad la yang bdag bzhin du goms par byas pa'i sgo nas ;
analyzed: ji ltar lag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // yang na ji ltar sems can thams cad la yang bdag bzhin du goms par byas pa'i sgo nas ;
translated: In order to teach this, it says, “Just as the hand,” and so on.

original: gzhan gyi don bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, just as with oneself, one should perform the welfare of others through the cultivation of all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach this, it says, “Just as the self,” and so on.

original: de ltar bdag dang sems can thams cad gcig pa nyid du gzung ba la yon tan ci yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang sems can thams cad gcig pa nyid du gzung ba la yon tan ci yod snyam pa la /
translated: In this way, what is the good quality of apprehending oneself and all sentient beings as the same?

original: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said, “In that case, etc.”

original: de bas na ji ltar zhes bya bas ni @332b mjug sdud do //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar zhes bya bas ni @332b mjug sdud do //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “How, etc.”

original: bsrung sems zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las so //
analyzed: bsrung sems zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las so //
translated: The thought of protection is from suffering.

original: snying rje'i sems zhes bya ba ni gong ma dang zlos pa'i phyir yi ge nor bar brtsi ste /
analyzed: snying rje'i sems zhes bya ba ni gong ma dang zlos pa'i phyir yi ge nor bar brtsi ste /
translated: The thought of compassion is from the above, and the letter is considered to be erroneous.

original: de bas na byang chub sems ni goms par bya zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems ni goms par bya zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “One should cultivate the thought of enlightenment.”

original: de bas na mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang gi mtshan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang gi mtshan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The Lord, etc.” One’s own name is

original: gang gis bdag gi ming thos pa de dag kyang 'jigs pa brgyad las thar bar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //🔽bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba da ni dka' ba'i phyir mi nus so snyam na /
analyzed: gang gis bdag gi ming thos pa de dag kyang 'jigs pa brgyad las thar bar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so // bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba da ni dka' ba'i phyir mi nus so snyam na /
translated: in the manner of “May those who hear my name be freed from the eight perils.”

original: goms par gyur na dka' ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: goms par gyur na dka' ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, if one thinks that one cannot do the sameness of oneself and others because it is difficult,

original: dka' las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dka' las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “The difficult, etc.”

original: gang gi ming zhes bya ba ni 'dre la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi ming zhes bya ba ni 'dre la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “name” is the ghost, etc.

original: de nyid med na zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'dris par gyur pa'i phyir 'dre la sogs pa de nyid med na'o //
analyzed: de nyid med na zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'dris par gyur pa'i phyir 'dre la sogs pa de nyid med na'o //
translated: “If it does not exist” means that if the ghost, etc. does not exist, because of the extreme familiarity.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya bar 'dod pa de /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya bar 'dod pa de /
translated: Thus, one who wishes to make oneself and others equal

original: las gang zhig la brtson 'grus brtsam par bya zhe na /
analyzed: las gang zhig la brtson 'grus brtsam par bya zhe na /
translated: in this way, in which work should one exert effort?

original: bdag gi bde ba gzhan la btang zhing gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gis dang du blang ba'i tshul gyis bdag dang gzhan brje bar bya ba nyan thos la sogs pas thos na /
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba gzhan la btang zhing gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gis dang du blang ba'i tshul gyis bdag dang gzhan brje bar bya ba nyan thos la sogs pas thos na /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should exert effort in the exchange of self and other, in the manner of giving one’s own happiness to others and taking their suffering upon oneself, which causes fear when heard by the śrāvakas, etc.,

original: skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir gsang bar bya ba de la brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang zhig bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir gsang bar bya ba de la brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / gang zhig bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “One should exert effort in that which is to be kept secret,” etc.🔽“One should exert effort in that which is to be kept secret” means that one should exert effort in the exchange of self and other, which causes fear when heard by the śrāvakas, etc.

original: ji tsam gyis bdag dang gzhan du brje ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis bdag dang gzhan du brje ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “One should exert effort in that which is to be kept secret” means that one should exert effort in the exchange of self and other, which causes fear when heard by the śrāvakas, etc.

original: gang zhig bdag gi bde ba zas dang skom la sogs pa gzhan la byin zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig bdag gi bde ba zas dang skom la sogs pa gzhan la byin zhing /
translated: It is also the case that one gives food, drink, and so on, which are one's own articles of happiness, to others,

original: de nyid kyi bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bdag gis dang du blangs pa lta bu yang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bdag gis dang du blangs pa lta bu yang yin mod kyi /
translated: and one accepts for oneself the suffering of hunger and so on.

original: de tsam 'ba' zhig la ni mi bya'am /
analyzed: de tsam 'ba' zhig la ni mi bya'am /
translated: But one should not do just that alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gang gi tshe sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: When one is governed by the morality of vow,

original: sems can thams cad bde bar bya'o zhes byams pa chen pos kun nas bslang nas /🔽gzhan bde ba dang phrad par bya ba'i don du bdag gi khyim gyi bde ba la sogs pa yal bar 'dor bar byed pa de tsam gyis na bde ba gzhan la btang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde bar bya'o zhes byams pa chen pos kun nas bslang nas / gzhan bde ba dang phrad par bya ba'i don du bdag gi khyim gyi bde ba la sogs pa yal bar 'dor bar byed pa de tsam gyis na bde ba gzhan la btang zhes bya ste /
translated: one is motivated by great love, thinking, I will bring about the happiness of all sentient beings.🔽In order to bring about the happiness of others, one gives up one's own happiness of home, and so on.🔽To that extent, one is said to give one's own happiness to others.

original: mdor na bdag gi bde ba gzhan bde bar bya ba'i phyir btab zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdor na bdag gi bde ba gzhan bde bar bya ba'i phyir btab zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In brief, one is said to give one's own happiness to others in order to make them happy.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gis dang du blang zhes bya ba yang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i snying rje chen @333a * //🔽pos kun nas bslang nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gis dang du blang zhes bya ba yang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i snying rje chen @333a * // pos kun nas bslang nas /
translated: Likewise, “I will take on the suffering of others” means that, motivated by great compassion to remove the suffering of others,

original: rab tu byung ba la sogs pa'i dka' las dang du blang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba la sogs pa'i dka' las dang du blang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I will take on the hardships of going forth and so on.

original: mdor na gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i don du bdag gis sdug bsngal nyams su blang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdor na gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i don du bdag gis sdug bsngal nyams su blang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In brief, it means that I will take on suffering for the sake of removing the suffering of others.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos gzhan dag la yang ci zhig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos gzhan dag la yang ci zhig par bya ste /
translated: The same should be done with other virtuous dharmas.

original: mdor na ci tsam du gzhan bde ba'i phyir bdag gi bde ba la mi lta ba de ni /
analyzed: mdor na ci tsam du gzhan bde ba'i phyir bdag gi bde ba la mi lta ba de ni /
translated: In brief, to the extent that I do not care about my own happiness for the sake of the happiness of others,

original: bdag gi bde ba gzhan la btang ba yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba gzhan la btang ba yin la /
translated: that is giving my own happiness to others.

original: ji tsam du gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir bya dka' ba ji snyed nyams su len pa ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gis dang du blangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir bya dka' ba ji snyed nyams su len pa ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gis dang du blangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To the extent that I take on the hardships of removing the suffering of others, that is taking on the suffering of others.

original: yang ci'i phyir bdag gi bde ba gzhan la gtang bar bya'i /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bdag gi bde ba gzhan la gtang bar bya'i /
translated: Why should one give one's own happiness to others?

original: bdag nyid la phan gdags par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la phan gdags par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one not benefit oneself?

original: bdag gi lus ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i 'jigs par bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gi lus ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i 'jigs par bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one's body is the cause of fear in this life and the next.

original: 'di la dgra bzhin du sdang bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'di la dgra bzhin du sdang bar bya'i /
translated: One should hate it as if it were an enemy.

original: bde bas phan gdags par bya rin mi chog go snyam nas /
analyzed: bde bas phan gdags par bya rin mi chog go snyam nas /
translated: It is not worthy of being benefited by happiness.

original: bdag dang lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag dang lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thinking thus, he says, One's body, etc.

original: 'jigs pa gnas chung ngu la yang zhes bya ba ni skrag par bya rin mi chog pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jigs pa gnas chung ngu la yang zhes bya ba ni skrag par bya rin mi chog pa la yang ngo //
translated: Even in the case of a small cause of fear means even in the case of something unworthy of being frightened.

original: ji ltar 'jigs pa skye ba'i gnas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jigs pa skye ba'i gnas yin zhe na /
translated: How is it a cause of fear?

original: rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this in detail, he says,

original: lus gang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lus gang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What body, etc.

original: su zhig ces bya ba ni gnyi ga yang dgag pa'i dgra ste /
analyzed: su zhig ces bya ba ni gnyi ga yang dgag pa'i dgra ste /
translated: Who is a double negation, meaning not at all.

original: su zhig de la 'dod cing bsrung ba dang / mchod par byed kyi su yang mi 'dod ces bya ba dang / su zhig dgra bzhin du sdang bar mi byed cing dgra bzhin du brnyas par mi byed de /
analyzed: su zhig de la 'dod cing bsrung ba dang / mchod par byed kyi su yang mi 'dod ces bya ba dang / su zhig dgra bzhin du sdang bar mi byed cing dgra bzhin du brnyas par mi byed de /
translated: Who would not be hostile to it as an enemy, and not despise it as an enemy?

original: lus 'di la dgra bzhin du sdang zhing brnyas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus 'di la dgra bzhin du sdang zhing brnyas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This body should be despised and hated as an enemy.

original: bdag gi don byas na nyes dmigs ci yod /
analyzed: bdag gi don byas na nyes dmigs ci yod /
translated: What is the disadvantage of doing what is beneficial for oneself?

original: gzhan gyi don byas na phan yon ci zhig yod nas rang gi don yal bar bor te gzhan gyi don la 'bad par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byas na phan yon ci zhig yod nas rang gi don yal bar bor te gzhan gyi don la 'bad par bya snyam pa la /
translated: What is the advantage of doing what is beneficial for others, that one should abandon what is beneficial for oneself and strive for the benefit of others?

original: gal te byin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te byin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If one gives to them, etc.

original: 'dre'i tshul zhes bya ba ni dman pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dre'i tshul zhes bya ba ni dman pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “demons” means “inferior conduct.”

original: lha'i chos zhes bya ba ni byad par gyi spyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lha'i chos zhes bya ba ni byad par gyi spyod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “divine” means “superior conduct.”

original: bdag phyir zhes bya ba ni bde bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag phyir zhes bya ba ni bde bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “For one’s own sake” means “for the sake of one’s own happiness.”

original: gzhan phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan bde bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan bde bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of others and so on means: for the sake of making others happy.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni bdag mtho bar 'dod nas bdag la stod par byed pa'o //🔽gzhan la spro byas na zhes @333b bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni bdag mtho bar 'dod nas bdag la stod par byed pa'o // gzhan la spro byas na zhes @333b bya ba ni /
translated: One's own means: desiring to be exalted, one praises oneself.

original: gzhan la spro bar bya ba'i phyir gzhan la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la spro bar bya ba'i phyir gzhan la bstod pa'o //
translated: One should encourage others means: in order to encourage others, one praises others.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya ba smos so //🔽de lta yin par ci mngon snyam pa la /
analyzed: mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya ba smos so // de lta yin par ci mngon snyam pa la /
translated: In order to teach in brief, he says in the world and so on.

original: mang du bshad lta zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mang du bshad lta zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: How is that known? He says because of the many explanations and so on.

original: bdag dang gzhan du ma brjes pa'i nyes dmigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du ma brjes pa'i nyes dmigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the other disadvantage of not exchanging oneself and others,

original: bdag bde zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag bde zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says one's own happiness and so on.

original: 'o na tshe phyi ma'i don 'grub pa ma snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na tshe phyi ma'i don 'grub pa ma snyam pa la /
translated: If one thinks but the goal of the next life is accomplished,

original: 'khor ba na yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'khor ba na yang zhes smos so //
translated: he says even in cyclic existence and so on.

original: 'o na tshe 'di'i don 'grub pa ma snyam pa la 'jig rten zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'o na tshe 'di'i don 'grub pa ma snyam pa la 'jig rten zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If one thinks but the goal of this life is accomplished, he says in the world and so on.

original: bdag dang gzhan du brje bar mi bya ba'i sgo nas de spong du gzhug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du brje bar mi bya ba'i sgo nas de spong du gzhug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make him give up that [self-cherishing] by means of exchanging self and other,

original: mthong dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: [the Buddha] says, “Seeing and not seeing.”

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
translated: “ Seeing” refers to this life.

original: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni tshe phyi ma la'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni tshe phyi ma la'o //
translated: “ Not seeing” refers to the next life.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa las gyur zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa'i dbang gis bdag gi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa las gyur zhes bya ba ni bdag tu chags pa'i dbang gis bdag gi don byed pa'o //
translated: “ Arising from self-grasping” means acting for the sake of the self through the power of attachment to the self.

original: 'dre chen zhes pa yang de nyid do //
analyzed: 'dre chen zhes pa yang de nyid do //
translated: “ Great demon” also refers to that [self-grasping].

original: da ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to make [the self and others] equal,

original: bdag dang gzhan brje bar bya'o zhes mjug bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan brje bar bya'o zhes mjug bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: [the Buddha] concludes by teaching, “Therefore, I should give up my self and take up the other.”

original: gnod pa dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yang shes par bya'o //
translated: “ Harm and suffering” are merely examples; you should understand that [the Buddha] also says this in order to attain happiness and mental pleasure.

original: gnod pa ni tshe 'di'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ni tshe 'di'o //
translated: Harm is in this life.

original: sdug bsngal ni tshe phyi ma'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni tshe phyi ma'o //
translated: Suffering is in the next life.

original: yang na gnod pa ni yid kyi'o //
analyzed: yang na gnod pa ni yid kyi'o //
translated: Or, the harm is mental,

original: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o //
translated: and the suffering is physical.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan du brje bar bya ba nyid du slob dpon nyid kyi thugs dang gzhan gyi rgyud bye brag ma phye bar spyir bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan du brje bar bya ba nyid du slob dpon nyid kyi thugs dang gzhan gyi rgyud bye brag ma phye bar spyir bstan to //
translated: Thus, the master himself teaches in general, without distinguishing his own continuum from that of others, the very exchange of self and other.

original: 'grel ba byed pa kha cig na re lung gis bstan pa zer mod kyi /
analyzed: 'grel ba byed pa kha cig na re lung gis bstan pa zer mod kyi /
translated: Some commentators say that this is taught by scripture.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not correct,

original: lung gang yang khungs su ma drangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gang yang khungs su ma drangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no scripture is cited as a source.

original: 'on te lung gi don bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lung gi don bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the meaning of scripture that is taught,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe 'di 'ba' zhig lung gis bstan pa zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe 'di 'ba' zhig lung gis bstan pa zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: then at that time it is not correct to say that this alone is taught by scripture,

original: gzhung mtha' dag gis kyang lung gi don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhung mtha' dag gis kyang lung gi don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entire text teaches the meaning of scripture.

original: de lta bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bye brag phye ba med par bdag dang gzhan gyi brje bar bya ba nyid du spyir ka dogs pa bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bye brag phye ba med par bdag dang gzhan gyi brje bar bya ba nyid du spyir ka dogs pa bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the very exchange of self and other is taught in general, without distinguishing one's own continuum from that of others.

original: da ni slob dpon gyis bye brag tu bdag nyid kyis yid la bdag dang gzhan du brje bar bya'o zhes gdams pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyis bye brag tu bdag nyid kyis yid la bdag dang gzhan du brje bar bya'o zhes gdams pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, the Master teaches the instruction, “I myself should exchange self and other,” in order to show this.

original: bdag ni zhes bya ba smos @334a * //🔽te ; bdag ni dbang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag ni zhes bya ba smos @334a * // te ; bdag ni dbang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He says, “I am the one who is in control,”

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba las rang gi don mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba las rang gi don mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because one’s own aim is not to be pursued as a goal, since I am the one who is in control.

original: gzhan dbang ba de nyid gang yin don ji lta bu zhig bya snyam pa la /🔽go rims bzhin du gzhan dbang ba de ni bdag nyid kyi phung po dang mig la sogs pa yin la /🔽don ni de la phan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan dbang ba de nyid gang yin don ji lta bu zhig bya snyam pa la / go rims bzhin du gzhan dbang ba de ni bdag nyid kyi phung po dang mig la sogs pa yin la / don ni de la phan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: What is the purpose of being in control of others?

original: gzhan dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to show that the purpose is the benefit of others, he says, “I am the one who is in control,” etc.

original: 'on te rang gi don bya ba la nyes ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi don bya ba la nyes ci yod ce na /
translated: But what is wrong with pursuing one’s own aim?

original: yid khyod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yid khyod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “You mind!,” etc.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi don bya ba la phan yon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi don bya ba la phan yon ci yod ce na /
translated: But what is the benefit of pursuing the aims of others?

original: de ltas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: las 'di zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //🔽phun sum bde ba min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las 'di zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'o // phun sum bde ba min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This action is the performance of the aim of another.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba thob pa las ma gtogs pa'i khams gsum gyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'di 'dra ba'i gnas skabs su re mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽da ni rang nyid la bdag tu bzung nas don byed pa byed bzhin du gzhan gyi don yang gis shig ces gdams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba thob pa las ma gtogs pa'i khams gsum gyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'di 'dra ba'i gnas skabs su re mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba'i don to // da ni rang nyid la bdag tu bzung nas don byed pa byed bzhin du gzhan gyi don yang gis shig ces gdams pa'i phyir /
translated: Not the highest good means that, except for the attainment of the bliss of the perfection of Buddhahood, one should not desire the situation of the suffering of the three realms of cyclic existence.

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to instruct him to perform the aim of another while holding himself dear, he says, Therefore, etc.

original: gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni pha ma la sogs pa'o //🔽gzhan gyi don ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba ni pha ma la sogs pa'o // gzhan gyi don ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
translated: Others means parents, etc.

original: gzhan gyi rtog ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtog ces bya ba smos te /
translated: How should one perform the aim of another? He says, The thought of others, etc.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la bde ba gang gis phongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gang dang ldan pa de nyid brtags nas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal zhing bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /🔽bdag gi bde ba la mi lta bar bor nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la bde ba gang gis phongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gang dang ldan pa de nyid brtags nas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal zhing bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir / bdag gi bde ba la mi lta bar bor nas /
translated: Having examined what kind of happiness others lack and what kind of suffering they possess, one should take up the suffering of others and give one's own happiness.

original: gzhan la phan pa byed pa'i sdug bsngal dang du blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa byed pa'i sdug bsngal dang du blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having abandoned one's own happiness without regard, one should take up the suffering of helping others.

original: de yang ji ltar bya snyam pa la /🔽bdag skyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
