analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The opposite of that is the meaning of “one will succeed.”

original: da ni de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, from the perspective of elaborating on that,🔽there are two: abandoning attachment to friends and so on, and abandoning attachment to the eight worldly dharmas.

original: gnyen 'dun la sogs pa la chags pa spang pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la chags pa spang pa gnyis las re zhig dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gnyen 'dun la sogs pa la chags pa spang pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la chags pa spang pa gnyis las re zhig dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From among those, first, with respect to the first,

original: mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are impermanent,

original: chags par byed pa mi rigs la /
analyzed: chags par byed pa mi rigs la /
translated: it is not reasonable to be attached.

original: gnyen la sogs pa yang mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir chags par bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnyen la sogs pa yang mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir chags par bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: Because friends and so on are impermanent, it is not reasonable to be attached,

original: myur du 'bral bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa'o //🔽da ni gnyen la sogs pa la lhag par chags pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: myur du 'bral bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa'o // da ni gnyen la sogs pa la lhag par chags pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: thinking, “They will quickly be separated.”🔽Now, in order to abandon attachment to friends and so on,

original: de la lhag par chags pa spang pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lhag par chags pa spang pa'i phyir /
translated: having taught the faults of being attached to friends and so on,

original: des ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said, “By that, one is not liberated.”

original: de la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu sdug pa ste yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po mtho ris dang thar pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu sdug pa ste yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po mtho ris dang thar pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above is that one does not attain high status or liberation due to the cause of excessive attachment to attractive, delightful things.

original: gzhan yang gnyen la sogs pa de mthong ba'i tshe na ni mthong na ci rung du snyam nas yid dga' bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyen la sogs pa de mthong ba'i tshe na ni mthong na ci rung du snyam nas yid dga' bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Moreover, when one sees one’s friends and so on, one’s mind is not pleased, thinking, “How nice it would be if I could see them.”

original: de'i dbang gis yid kyang ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis yid kyang ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Due to their influence, one’s mind also does not rest in equipoise in samādhi.

original: 'o na mthong na phan nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mthong na phan nam zhe na /
translated: If one sees them, what is the benefit?

original: mthong yang ngoms par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: mthong yang ngoms par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: One is not satisfied by seeing them.

original: snga ma bzhin de sngar ma phrang pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du da rung yang ma bral na ni ci ma rung snyam pa'i sred pas gdung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin de sngar ma phrang pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du da rung yang ma bral na ni ci ma rung snyam pa'i sred pas gdung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As before, one is tormented by craving, thinking, “How nice it would be if I were not separated from them now, as I was before.”

original: nyes dmigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach another fault, it says:

original: sems can rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For sentient beings who are tormented by the fire of desire,

original: kun nas sgrib ces bya ba ni de'i rkyen gyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la mi sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas sgrib ces bya ba ni de'i rkyen gyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la mi sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Obscured” means that one does not think about the suffering of cyclic existence due to those conditions.

original: tha mar zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus su 'gyod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mar zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus su 'gyod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “In the end” means at the time of death, one will have regrets.

original: don med ces bya ba ni dge ba ma brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med ces bya ba ni dge ba ma brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Meaningless” means that one has not undertaken virtue.

original: 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Destruction” means that one will not attain nirvana.

original: skal ba mnyam spyod na zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam spyod na zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “In the same situation” means that one will follow nonvirtuous actions.

original: dga' ba'i gnas la zhes bya ba ni dga' bar byed pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba'i gnas la zhes bya ba ni dga' bar byed pa'i gnas so //
translated: “In a place of joy” means a place that causes joy.

original: gzhan yang byis pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang byis pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the characteristics of fools,

original: phan par smras na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phan par smras na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “When they are told what is beneficial,” and so on.

original: phan las zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las so //
analyzed: phan las zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las so //
translated: “Beneficial” means virtuous action.

original: bzlog ces bya ba ni pha rol po @336b de dag go //
analyzed: bzlog ces bya ba ni pha rol po @336b de dag go //
translated: “Turn away” means those others.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: res 'ga' phrad pa'i tshe ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: res 'ga' phrad pa'i tshe ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
translated: Sometimes one thinks, “What should I do when I meet them?”

original: phrad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phrad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, “If I meet them…”

original: chos kyi don tsam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi don tsam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The mere purpose of the Dharma” is

original: gdams ngag 'tsho ba'i rkyen tsam mo //
analyzed: gdams ngag 'tsho ba'i rkyen tsam mo //
translated: merely the condition of the instruction for living.

original: kun la zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “To all” means to the benefactors, etc.

original: da ni gnyis pa 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad la chags pa spang ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni gnyis pa 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad la chags pa spang ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, the second, in consideration of the abandonment of attachment to the eight worldly dharmas,

original: de'i nyes dmigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the teaching of its disadvantages is stated.

original: bdag ni rnyed mang bkur sti zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag ni rnyed mang bkur sti zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “I have much gain, respect…” and so forth.

original: 'o na ji ltar spang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar spang bar bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, how should it be abandoned?

original: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, “These…” and so forth.

original: mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is impermanent, that is the meaning.

original: de bas na de dag dang rtag tu 'grogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na de dag dang rtag tu 'grogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is the meaning that one should always associate with them.

original: stong pa dang smod pa la dga' ba dang mi dga' ba spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa dang smod pa la dga' ba dang mi dga' ba spong ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon delighting in and disliking emptiness and disparagement,

original: bdag la smod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag la smod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse I am not to be praised, etc. is stated.

original: sems can thams cad bdag la stod pa'am smod par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /🔽kha cig de ltar byed pa tsam gyis dga' ba'am /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag la stod pa'am smod par byed pa ni ma yin gyi / kha cig de ltar byed pa tsam gyis dga' ba'am /
translated: It is not the case that all sentient beings praise or disparage me.

original: mi dga' bar bya rin chen mi chog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dga' bar bya rin chen mi chog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not worth being pleased or displeased by the mere fact that some do so.🔽 This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin snyam pa la sems can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin snyam pa la sems can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is that so? He says sentient beings, etc.

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means because of their various inclinations.

original: sems can rnyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag dang 'grogs pa spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can rnyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag dang 'grogs pa spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse I am not to be sought, etc. is stated to show that one should avoid associating with them.

original: da ni zhi gnas kyi tshogs las gnyis pa dgon par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas dgon par gnas pa'i phan yon bstan pa la /
analyzed: da ni zhi gnas kyi tshogs las gnyis pa dgon par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas dgon par gnas pa'i phan yon bstan pa la /
translated: Now, in the second part of the chapter on the prerequisites for samādhi, the benefits of dwelling in the forest are taught from the perspective of the forest-dweller.

original: dang po grogs kyi dbang du byas pa'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dang po grogs kyi dbang du byas pa'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: First, from the perspective of the benefits in terms of companions,

original: nags zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nags zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, forest.

original: lus dang longs spyod la lhag par chags pa mi skye ba'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod la lhag par chags pa mi skye ba'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The benefits of non-arising of excessive attachment to body and enjoyments are considered.

original: phug gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phug gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, in a cave, etc.

original: rgyab tu mi lta zhing zhes bya ba ni 'phrog pa dang / bsad pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyab tu mi lta zhing zhes bya ba ni 'phrog pa dang / bsad pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says, not looking back, because of the absence of fear of being robbed and killed.

original: nags tshol ba'i zhen pa dang / spong mi nus pa'i zhen pa med pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nags tshol ba'i zhen pa dang / spong mi nus pa'i zhen pa med pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The benefits of the absence of attachment to seeking a forest and the absence of attachment to inability to renounce are taught.

original: sa phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sa phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, in a place, etc.

original: longs spyod phrogs kyis dogs pa dang / lus kyi mi mdzes pa'i gnas gzhan gyis mthong bar dogs pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phan yon @337a * //🔽bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod phrogs kyis dogs pa dang / lus kyi mi mdzes pa'i gnas gzhan gyis mthong bar dogs pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phan yon @337a * // bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The benefits of the absence of fear of the apprehension of being robbed of enjoyments and the apprehension of others seeing the unattractive state of the body are taught.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, in a begging bowl, etc.

original: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas /
translated: The cultivation of the application of mindfulness to the body by way of the external body is finished.

original: lus la rtag pa dang gtsang ba nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa bskyed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dur khrod ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lus la rtag pa dang gtsang ba nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa bskyed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dur khrod ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The cemetery is mentioned in order to teach the development of the antidote which abandons the afflictions of the manifest clinging to the body as permanent and as pure.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni gzhan shi ba'i lus mthong ba spyi'i dbang du byas nas ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni gzhan shi ba'i lus mthong ba spyi'i dbang du byas nas ston to //
translated: The first verse teaches in general, from the viewpoint of seeing the body of another person who has died.

original: gnyis pas ni shi nas zhag bdun lon pa'i dbang du byas nas ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni shi nas zhag bdun lon pa'i dbang du byas nas ston to //
translated: The second teaches from the viewpoint of seven days after death.

original: lus 'di gcig pu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgon par gnas pa'i tshe gnyen 'dun la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rgyus yid mi bde ba spang ba'i phyir gnyen po ji ltar bsgom pa bstan to /
analyzed: lus 'di gcig pu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgon par gnas pa'i tshe gnyen 'dun la sogs pa dang bral ba'i rgyus yid mi bde ba spang ba'i phyir gnyen po ji ltar bsgom pa bstan to /
translated: The verse beginning “This body, alone, etc.” teaches the development of the antidote in order to abandon mental unhappiness due to separation from relatives, etc., when living in the forest.

original: rkyen gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyen po la sogs pa dang bral bar mi phod pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: rkyen gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyen po la sogs pa dang bral bar mi phod pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning “What conditions, etc.” teaches the development of the antidote to the inability to bear separation from relatives, etc.

original: lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgon par gnas pa'i tshe gnyen la sogs pa dang lhan cig mi 'grogs pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgon par gnas pa'i tshe gnyen la sogs pa dang lhan cig mi 'grogs pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning This body teaches the benefit of not associating with relatives, etc. when staying in the wilderness.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phan yon brtag pa'i sgo nas dgon par gnas par bya bar gdams pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phan yon brtag pa'i sgo nas dgon par gnas par bya bar gdams pa bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning Therefore teaches the instruction to stay in the wilderness by way of considering the benefits.

original: da ni tshogs la gnas pa des mnyam par 'jog pa'i skabs su ji ltar btsal bar bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bsam pa gzhan gyi bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni tshogs la gnas pa des mnyam par 'jog pa'i skabs su ji ltar btsal bar bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bsam pa gzhan gyi bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in the context of that staying in the assembly, in the context of how to search in the occasion of equipoise, he says, other thoughts, etc.

original: bsam pa gzhan ni zhes pa ni bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa lnga'o //
analyzed: bsam pa gzhan ni zhes pa ni bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa lnga'o //
translated: Other thoughts are the five hindrances to concentration.

original: bdag la sems pas zhes bya bas ni bdag ci'i phyir dgon par 'ongs zhes bya bsams nas bdag ni sgrib pa spang ba'i don du 'ongs so //
analyzed: bdag la sems pas zhes bya bas ni bdag ci'i phyir dgon par 'ongs zhes bya bsams nas bdag ni sgrib pa spang ba'i don du 'ongs so //
translated: By thinking about oneself he means that one should think, Why did I come to the wilderness? and then think, I came to abandon the hindrances.

original: mnyam par gzhag phyir zhes bya ba ni rgod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mtho ba dang / bying ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dma' ba spang ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag phyir zhes bya ba ni rgod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mtho ba dang / bying ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dma' ba spang ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: For the sake of equipoise means that one should abandon the high state of mind that has the characteristic of agitation and the low state of mind that has the characteristic of laxity.

original: dul bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa las so //🔽da ni bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa lnga las 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: dul bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa las so // da ni bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa lnga las 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: For the sake of taming means for the sake of the afflictions.🔽Now, in order to demonstrate the disadvantages of abandoning the five hindrances to meditative concentration,

original: de spang bar bya ba mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he briefly teaches the abandonment of desire.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, In this world and the next, and so on.

original: de dag nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that in detail,

original: de la dang por 'dod ldan ngan pa zhes bya ba nas rgas na 'dod pas ci zhig bya ba'i bar gyis tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs bstan @337b te ;
analyzed: de la dang por 'dod ldan ngan pa zhes bya ba nas rgas na 'dod pas ci zhig bya ba'i bar gyis tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs bstan @337b te ;
translated: he says, The desire of the wicked, and so on, up to What will old age do with desire?

original: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: da ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i nyes dmigs bsdus te bstan pa'i sgo nas de sgrub pa'i don du /
analyzed: da ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i nyes dmigs bsdus te bstan pa'i sgo nas de sgrub pa'i don du /
translated: Now, in order to accomplish the abandonment of desire, he teaches the disadvantages of this and the next world in brief.

original: dal 'byor chud zos par byas pa'am /
analyzed: dal 'byor chud zos par byas pa'am /
translated: having wasted the optimum human rebirth,

original: de chud za bar mi bya ba gdams pa zur gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de chud za bar mi bya ba gdams pa zur gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the advice not to waste it,

original: 'dod ldan rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dod ldan rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “For those who are desirous” and so on.

original: da ni 'dod pa la zhen pa spangs te de bas shin tu tshegs chung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa la zhen pa spangs te de bas shin tu tshegs chung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to abandon attachment to desire and to show that it is much more difficult to do that,

original: thar pa thob par bya ba'i don la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thar pa thob par bya ba'i don la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that one should strive for the goal of attaining liberation,

original: 'dod so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dod so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If you think, ‘I will enjoy myself’ and so on.

original: 'on te 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa ji tsam du nyes dmigs che bas de spang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa ji tsam du nyes dmigs che bas de spang bar bya zhe na /
translated: But if you think, ‘Since attachment to desire is so very harmful, I will abandon it,’

original: de'i dpe med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dpe med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that there is no example for that,

original: 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: he says, “There is no example” and so on.

original: de dag gis ni tshe 'di'i srog 'phrog par byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag gis ni tshe 'di'i srog 'phrog par byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The thought is that they merely steal the life of this existence,

original: tshe phyi mar dmyal ba la sogs par ltung bar byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi mar dmyal ba la sogs par ltung bar byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: but they are not able to cause you to fall into the hells and so on in the next life.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi yo byad la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi yo byad la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the abandonment of the discursive thought of desire for external objects,

original: nga ni nang sems can la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nga ni nang sems can la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the abandonment of the discursive thought of desire for internal sentient beings,

original: 'dod ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dod ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says “The desirous one” and so on.

original: reg bya shin tu 'jam pa shing la sogs par yang nyal po bya bar mi rung zhes bsams nas /
analyzed: reg bya shin tu 'jam pa shing la sogs par yang nyal po bya bar mi rung zhes bsams nas /
translated: Even with regard to a very soft object, such as a tree, one should not have sexual intercourse.

original: de la chags par mi byed na /
analyzed: de la chags par mi byed na /

original: de'i tshe sems la yang reg bya'i sgo nas ci'i phyir chags par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems la yang reg bya'i sgo nas ci'i phyir chags par byed de /

original: chags par byar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chags par byar mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not reasonable to become attached.

original: da ni gos kyi sgo nas chags par byar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gos kyi sgo nas chags par byar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that it is not reasonable to become attached through clothing,

original: gang la g-yogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang la g-yogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “If one is covered with it” and so on.

original: snga ma las ngan par gyur pa med par gyur pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma las ngan par gyur pa med par gyur pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it is not better than the previous one.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod par byed ces bya ba ni bla lhag tu bzang bar gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod par byed ces bya ba ni bla lhag tu bzang bar gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Why do you desire it?  Because there is nothing better than that.

original: de ni mi gtsang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni mi gtsang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That is impure.

original: chags par bya bar mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chags par bya bar mi rigs par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the inappropriateness of attachment to it is:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If, in the case of a corpse,

original: yan lag gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the parts is easy to understand.

original: da ni dri'i sgo nas chags par mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dri'i sgo nas chags par mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the inappropriateness of attachment by way of smell,

original: lus la bskus pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'o //
analyzed: lus la bskus pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'o //
translated: he says, Smeared with excrement, etc.

original: da ni rmugs pa dang gnyid sdang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rmugs pa dang gnyid sdang ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the inappropriateness of attachment by way of sluggishness and drowsiness,

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, If, in the case of a corpse, etc.

original: bag yod gtam @338a * //
analyzed: bag yod gtam @338a * //
translated: The discourse on heedfulness

original: ni zhes bya ba rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi gnyen por ting nge 'dzin gyi phan yon dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba'i yon tan rjes su dran pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi gnyen por ting nge 'dzin gyi phan yon dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba'i yon tan rjes su dran pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: is the antidote to sluggishness and drowsiness, consisting of the recollection of the benefits of concentration and the recollection of the greatness of the virtues of the Tathagata, etc.

original: 'on te bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa lnga yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa lnga yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren't there five obstructions to concentration?

original: 'dir 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnyid spang pa 'ba' zhig bshad kyi gzhan dag ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnyid spang pa 'ba' zhig bshad kyi gzhan dag ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
translated: Here only the abandonment of sensual desire and sleep is explained, but why are the others not explained?

original: rgod pa spang ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa spang ba'i thabs ji skad bstan pa nyid kyis 'grub pa'i phyir dang / 'gyod pa spang ba ni le'u gnyis par sdom pa yang dag par blang ba'i cho ga ji skad bshad pa bzhin du yang dag par blangs pas sdom pa legs par mgon nas sam snyam pa'i 'gyod pa yang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: rgod pa spang ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa spang ba'i thabs ji skad bstan pa nyid kyis 'grub pa'i phyir dang / 'gyod pa spang ba ni le'u gnyis par sdom pa yang dag par blang ba'i cho ga ji skad bshad pa bzhin du yang dag par blangs pas sdom pa legs par mgon nas sam snyam pa'i 'gyod pa yang mi 'byung la /
translated: Since the method of abandoning agitation is accomplished by the method of abandoning sensual desire explained above, and since the abandonment of regret is not produced by properly taking vows as explained in chapter 2, one thinks, “I have properly taken vows.”

original: le'u gsum pa dang bzhi par sdom pa bsrung ba'i thabs ji skad bshad pa bzhin du bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u gsum pa dang bzhi par sdom pa bsrung ba'i thabs ji skad bshad pa bzhin du bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since one protects vows in accordance with the method of protecting vows explained in chapters 3 and 4,

original: legs par ma bshags sam snyam pa'i 'gyod pa yang mi 'byung zhing res 'ga' ltung ba 'byung yang le'u gnyis par sdug pa rnam par sbyong ba'i thabs ji skad bshad pa dang / le'u gsum par nyes pa byung ba re re zhing /🔽byang ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa bzhin du /
analyzed: legs par ma bshags sam snyam pa'i 'gyod pa yang mi 'byung zhing res 'ga' ltung ba 'byung yang le'u gnyis par sdug pa rnam par sbyong ba'i thabs ji skad bshad pa dang / le'u gsum par nyes pa byung ba re re zhing / byang ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa bzhin du /
translated: Even if one sometimes commits a downfall, one has no regret thinking that one has not confessed well the downfall that has occurred, as explained in chapter 2, the method for purifying the faults, and as explained in chapter 3, the purification of each fault and so on.

original: sdig pa rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir ltung ba byung ba legs par ma bshags sam snyam pa'i 'gyod pa yang mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / gnod sems spang ba ni le'u lnga pa las bshad zin pa'i phyir dang / the tshom spang ba ni le'u brgyad pa las ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: sdig pa rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir ltung ba byung ba legs par ma bshags sam snyam pa'i 'gyod pa yang mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / gnod sems spang ba ni le'u lnga pa las bshad zin pa'i phyir dang / the tshom spang ba ni le'u brgyad pa las ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: Because one has no regret, one abandons malice, since malice has been explained in chapter 5, and one abandons doubt, since doubt will be explained in chapter 8.

original: da ni bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Now, having explained the disadvantages of not abandoning the obscurations to meditative stabilization,

original: sgrib pa gnyis spang ba'i don du bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa lnga spangs te /
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis spang ba'i don du bsam gtan gyi sgrib pa lnga spangs te /
translated: in order to abandon the two obscurations, one abandons the five obscurations to meditative stabilization.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag par bya bar gdams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag par bya bar gdams pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to instruct in the equipoise of mind,

original: rgyal sras zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyal sras zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “The victors’ heirs, etc.”

original: bstan bcos kyi ming gdags pa ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽bsam gtan bstan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi ming gdags pa ni snga ma bzhin no // bsam gtan bstan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The designation of the treatise name is as before.

original: le'u bdun pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u bdun pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is the commentary on the seventh chapter, having the name “Concentration.”

original: // / da ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag des go 'phang khyad par can thob par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: // / da ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag des go 'phang khyad par can thob par bya ba'i don du /
translated: Now, in order to generate the wisdom of the person who has equipoised the mind for the purpose of attaining the special state,

original: shes rab bskyed par bya ba'i phyir le'u brgyad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab bskyed par bya ba'i phyir le'u brgyad pa gsungs te /
translated: the eighth chapter is taught in order to generate wisdom.

original: de la gar la brten te bskyed par bya zhe na /🔽bsam gtan gyi le'ur zhi gnas kyi tshogs ga la gnas te /
analyzed: de la gar la brten te bskyed par bya zhe na / bsam gtan gyi le'ur zhi gnas kyi tshogs ga la gnas te /
translated: In dependence on what is it generated?🔽In the chapter on concentration, the accumulations of serenity are gathered.🔽Where is it gathered?🔽In the cultivation of serenity.

original: zhi gnas @338b bsgom par bya ba nyid du bsdogs pa 'di dag thams cad kyang gang gi don du bsdogs she na /
analyzed: zhi gnas @338b bsgom par bya ba nyid du bsdogs pa 'di dag thams cad kyang gang gi don du bsdogs she na /
translated: For what purpose is all of this gathered?

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la shes rab bskyed pa'i don du bsdogs te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la shes rab bskyed pa'i don du bsdogs te /
translated: It is gathered for the purpose of generating wisdom in one’s own and others’ continuums.

original: gang du bsam gtan bstan pa'i le'ur /
analyzed: gang du bsam gtan bstan pa'i le'ur /
translated: In the chapter on concentration,

original: zhi gnas rab tu ldan pa'i lhag mthong gis //
analyzed: zhi gnas rab tu ldan pa'i lhag mthong gis //
translated: And with insight well-integrated with serenity,

original: nyon mongs rnam par 'joms par shes byas nas //
analyzed: nyon mongs rnam par 'joms par shes byas nas //
translated: One should know that the afflictions are destroyed.

original: thog mar zhi gnas btsal bya zhes /
analyzed: thog mar zhi gnas btsal bya zhes /
translated: Therefore, first seek serenity.

original: de skad du bsdogs pa de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la mya ngan las 'das pa dang bde ba 'dod pas /
analyzed: de skad du bsdogs pa de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la mya ngan las 'das pa dang bde ba 'dod pas /
translated: Thus it is taught. Therefore, if you desire nirvana and happiness for yourself and others,

original: de thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: you should generate wisdom in order to attain them.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don to //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don to //
translated: Nirvana is for one’s own sake,

original: bde ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: bde ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: and happiness is for the sake of others.

original: yang na mya ngan las 'das pa ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mya ngan las 'das pa ni spangs pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, nirvana is abandonment,

original: bde ba ni ye shes so //
analyzed: bde ba ni ye shes so //
translated: and happiness is wisdom.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni nges par legs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni nges par legs pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the definite goodness,

original: bde ba ni mngon par mtho ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni mngon par mtho ba'o //
translated: and happiness is the higher realms.

original: de ltar bsam gtan ldan pa des mya ngan las 'das pa dang bde ba thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab gang bskyed par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan ldan pa des mya ngan las 'das pa dang bde ba thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab gang bskyed par bya snyam pa la /
translated: Thus, in order to attain nirvana and happiness, one should generate wisdom.

original: don dam pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don dam pa dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The line the ultimate, etc. is stated.

original: 'dis ni yul bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i shes rab de bskyed par bya'o zhes bstan te //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i shes rab de bskyed par bya'o zhes bstan te //
translated: This teaches that one should generate the wisdom that focuses on the two truths as its object.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The line explained is a verb, and the line by the Tathagata is a noun.

original: de dag gi so so'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin snyam pa la don dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi so so'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin snyam pa la don dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What are their individual characteristics? The line the ultimate, etc. is stated.

original: don dam blo'i spyod yul min //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don dam blo'i spyod yul min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ultimate is not the domain of the intellect.🔽The line the ultimate is not the domain of the intellect is stated.

original: blo zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The word intellect is used here merely as an illustration.

original: sgra'i yul ma yin pa yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sgra'i yul ma yin pa yang shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that it is not the domain of words as well.🔽 As a sutra states:

analyzed: ji skad du mdo las don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems rgyu ba yang med na /
translated: If the mind does not move even toward the ultimate truth,🔽what need is there to mention words?🔽And also:

original: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes 'byung ba dang / yang lha'i bu don dam par don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes 'byung ba dang / yang lha'i bu don dam par don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Divine son, ultimately, the ultimate truth is completely beyond all conventions.

original: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa brjod pa dang bral ba shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa brjod pa dang bral ba shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unborn, unceasing, inexpressible, free from consciousness and the object of consciousness.

original: 'on te don dam pa ji ltar blo'i spyod yul ma yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'on te don dam pa ji ltar blo'i spyod yul ma yin snyam pa la /
translated: But if you think, “How can the ultimate be beyond the scope of the intellect?”

original: don dam par ni rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin la /
analyzed: don dam par ni rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin la /
translated: The ultimate is just as it is known.

original: rig pas dpyad na dngos po gang yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: rig pas dpyad na dngos po gang yang ma grub ste /
translated: When analyzed by the intellect, no entity is established.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a sūtra says:

analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhags na ni // gzhan dbang med @339a * //
translated: When examined by the mind,🔽There is no dependent nature,

original: cing brtag pa'ang med //
analyzed: cing brtag pa'ang med //
translated: And there is no imputed nature.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis kyang /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis kyang /
translated: And Ārya Nāgārjuna says:

original: gang ci brjod pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: gang ci brjod pa thams cad ni //
translated: Whatever is expressed is to be known

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong rig bya //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong rig bya //
translated: As empty by nature.

original: stong pa zhes bya de yang stong //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya de yang stong //
translated: What is called “empty” is also empty.

original: 'di ltar mi stong yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi stong yod ma yin //
translated: Thus, there is nothing that is not empty.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang ; bden pa gnyis las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang ; bden pa gnyis las /
translated: And in the Two Truths, it says:

original: de nyid phyir na de stong min //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na de stong min //
translated: Therefore, it is not empty.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas gang ltar yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas gang ltar yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in any case, it is not established.

original: rig pas dpyad na blo dang sgras ji ltar yul du byar med do //
analyzed: rig pas dpyad na blo dang sgras ji ltar yul du byar med do //
translated: When analyzed by reasoning, the object is not an object of mind and words.

original: yang na don dam pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: yang na don dam pa zhes bya ba ni / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la /
translated: Or, “ultimate” means🔽the mere elimination of the superimposition of conceptual elaborations

original: sgro btags pa'i spros pa rnam par chad pa tsam du zad pas /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i spros pa rnam par chad pa tsam du zad pas /
translated: in the dependent characteristic.

original: de la ni blo dang sgras ji ltar yang yul du byar med na /
analyzed: de la ni blo dang sgras ji ltar yang yul du byar med na /
translated: Since it is not an object of mind and words in any way,

original: dgag pa tsam ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dgag pa tsam ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: it is a mere negation, nothing at all.

original: de las bzlog pa /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa /
translated: The opposite of that

original: blo dang sgra ni kun rdzob yin //
analyzed: blo dang sgra ni kun rdzob yin //
translated: is mind and words, which are conventional.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa gnyis bstan pa las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa gnyis bstan pa las /
translated: In the teaching on the two noble truths,

original: ji skad du lha'i bu gal te ;
analyzed: ji skad du lha'i bu gal te ;
translated: it says, “Divine son, if

analyzed: don dam par ni don dam pa'i bden pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi ngo bor gyur na ni /
translated: the ultimate truth were the nature of the object of body, speech, and mind,

original: de don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro'o //
translated: it would not be counted as the ultimate truth.

original: de kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be only the conventional truth.

original: lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i yul las kyang yang dag par 'das pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i yul las kyang yang dag par 'das pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The sutra taught by Aksayamati also states:

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is relative truth?

original: ji snyed 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa dang / yi ge dang skad dang brdas bstan pa dag go zhes bya ba ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji snyed 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa dang / yi ge dang skad dang brdas bstan pa dag go zhes bya ba ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is the world’s conventions, terms, languages, and expressions.
