analyzed: kun rdzob ni ji ltar snang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: The relative is what appears as things do.

original: zhib tu ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos gzhan dag las kyang shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhib tu ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos gzhan dag las kyang shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This can be understood in detail from other treatises on the Middle Way.

original: 'dir rgya ma bskyed do //
analyzed: 'dir rgya ma bskyed do //
translated: I will not elaborate on it here.

original: da ni dngos po bdag nyid la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i sgo nas dngos po'i bdag nyid dpyad par bya bar mdor bstan pa'i phyir de la zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dngos po'i bdag nyid bstan ma thag pa de la rnal 'byor pa dang / pham pa dang mthun pas phal pa ste /
analyzed: da ni dngos po bdag nyid la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i sgo nas dngos po'i bdag nyid dpyad par bya bar mdor bstan pa'i phyir de la zhes bya ba smos te / dngos po'i bdag nyid bstan ma thag pa de la rnal 'byor pa dang / pham pa dang mthun pas phal pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to briefly indicate the analysis of the nature of things by way of eliminating misconceptions about the nature of things, he says, “In that regard,”🔽and so on. The nature of things has just been presented. In that regard, there are two kinds of people: yogis and ordinary beings.

original: mdo sde pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa @339b rnam pa gnyis kyi go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: mdo sde pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa @339b rnam pa gnyis kyi go rims bzhin du /
translated: The latter are called “ordinary” because they are defeated by the afflictions.🔽The former are called “yogis” because they are victorious over the afflictions.

original: gnyis med pa'i tshul dang / gnyis kyi tshul du mthong ste /
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i tshul dang / gnyis kyi tshul du mthong ste /
translated: These two kinds of people see the nature of things in two ways, respectively: in a nondual way and in a dualistic way.

original: de la rnal 'byor spyod pas 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa sun 'byin par byed cing 'jig rten phal pa las gong mar gyur pa 'byor pa'i 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor spyod pas 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa sun 'byin par byed cing 'jig rten phal pa las gong mar gyur pa 'byor pa'i 'dod pa de ni /
translated: The yogis refute the assertions of ordinary beings, and the assertions of yogis are refuted by the assertions of the Madhyamaka, which is superior to the Yogācāra.

original: de las gong mar gyur pa dbu ma pa'i lta ba'i khyad par gyis sun 'byin par byed pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid la dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las gong mar gyur pa dbu ma pa'i lta ba'i khyad par gyis sun 'byin par byed pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid la dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the nature of things should be analyzed. This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: da ni re zhig de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas 'on te 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni re zhig de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas 'on te 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa ni /
translated: Now, from the perspective of explaining that in detail, it is said, “But the assertions of ordinary worldly people…”

original: gang de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa pas ni ji ltar sun 'byin par byad ce na /
analyzed: gang de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa pas ni ji ltar sun 'byin par byad ce na /
translated: How do yogis and yoginis refute that?

original: 'jig rten phal pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten phal pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “Ordinary worldly people…”

original: 'jig rten phal pa mdo sde pa la sogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten phal pa mdo sde pa la sogs so //
translated: Ordinary worldly people are Sautrantikas and so forth.

original: dngos mthong la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos mthong la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Seeing things” refers to forms and so forth.

original: yang dag nyid du'ang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi don nyid du yang dag par ro //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du'ang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi don nyid du yang dag par ro //
translated: “ In reality” means that they are external objects that appear as they do.

original: sgyu ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de ltar snang bar ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de ltar snang bar ro //
translated: “ Like an illusion” means that they appear in that way.

original: ji ltar rtsod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtsod ce na /
translated: How do they argue?

original: gzugs la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “Forms and so forth…”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis mngon sum nyid du 'khrul nas de snang ba'i tshad mas 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis mngon sum nyid du 'khrul nas de snang ba'i tshad mas 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Forms and so forth are confused as direct perceptions due to the ripening of the habitual tendencies of conceptual elaborations. They are not established by valid knowledge that perceives them.

original: de grub par byed pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de grub par byed pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no reasoning to establish that, and because it is undermined by valid cognition, such as being one or many.

original: dper na mi gtsang pa la gtsang bar 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na mi gtsang pa la gtsang bar 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is like apprehending the impure as pure.

original: 'on te de ltar na 'phags pa don rnam par nges pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na 'phags pa don rnam par nges pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las /
translated: If you say, “In that case, it contradicts the scriptures, such as the noble Dharma discourse called the Determination of the Meanings,

original: gzugs gang zhe na /🔽gzugs gang yin pa ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang zhe na / gzugs gang yin pa ci'ang rung ste /
translated: which says, ‘What is form?

original: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Whatever is form is all derived from the four great elements.’🔽”

original: 'jig rten gzung bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzung bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is “The world is apprehended,” and so on.

original: 'di skad du 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i skye bo dag gzung bar bya ba'i ched du bstan pa yin gyi dngos su yod pa'i phyir bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i skye bo dag gzung bar bya ba'i ched du bstan pa yin gyi dngos su yod pa'i phyir bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is saying, “It is taught for the purpose of apprehending those beings who are to be disciplined, but it is not taught because it actually exists.

original: des na 'gal ba med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba med do zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction.”

original: ci de lta bu'i dpe mthong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de lta bu'i dpe mthong ngam zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Have you seen such an example?”

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is “Like an illusion, etc.”

original: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As the noble Perfection of Wisdom says,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /🔽dper na de bzhin gshegs @340a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste / dper na de bzhin gshegs @340a * //
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this.

original: pa shin tu zhi ba zhes bya bas lung bstan par bya ba'i sems can 'ga' yang ma gzigs nas sprul pa zhig sprul te /
analyzed: pa shin tu zhi ba zhes bya bas lung bstan par bya ba'i sems can 'ga' yang ma gzigs nas sprul pa zhig sprul te /
translated: The Tathāgata, the one who sees things as they are, sees no sentient beings at all to be predicted to unsurpassed, perfect awakening.🔽Then he emanates an emanation, and that emanation predicts to unsurpassed, perfect awakening those sentient beings who are to be predicted by the Tathāgata.

original: myang ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: myang ngan las 'das so //
translated: Then that emanation passes into nirvāṇa.

original: de nas sprul pa des sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa des sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas te /
translated: Then the emanation performs the activities of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan te /
translated: Having predicted the bodhisattvas to unsurpassed awakening,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: it passes into nirvāṇa.”

original: gdul bya'i rgyud la bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i rgyud la bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, in order to generate merit in the mindstreams of disciples,

original: sprul pa sgyu ma lta bu bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sprul pa sgyu ma lta bu bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: the Buddha emanates an emanation, like an illusory emanation.

original: de ltar 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa rnal 'byor spyod pas ji ltar sun 'byin pa'i tshul bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa rnal 'byor spyod pas ji ltar sun 'byin pa'i tshul bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown how the yogācāra rejects the assertions of ordinary worldly people,

original: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i 'dod pa dbu ma pas ji ltar sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gal te sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i 'dod pa dbu ma pas ji ltar sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir / gal te sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how the Followers of the Middle Way refute the assertions of the proponents of Yogic Practice, the text says:🔽If you say, “Sentient beings…”

original: gal te sems can 'di dag kyang don dam par rang bzhin med pa yin na /🔽sgyu ma bzhin du shi ba'i rjes la yang /
analyzed: gal te sems can 'di dag kyang don dam par rang bzhin med pa yin na / sgyu ma bzhin du shi ba'i rjes la yang /
translated: If you say, “Sentient beings are ultimately devoid of any nature,”🔽then it follows that, like an illusion, they would not take birth after death.

original: mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: skye ba'i phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they must exist ultimately, because they are born.”🔽Since everything is relative, it is not certain that all relative phenomena are samsara.

original: thams cad kun rdzob yin pas kun rdzob thams cad 'khor ba yin pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir rkyen rnams rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad kun rdzob yin pas kun rdzob thams cad 'khor ba yin pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir rkyen rnams rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore the text says, “Conditions are causes…”🔽When the antidote—wisdom—has not arisen, the causes—karma and afflictions—are not reversed.

original: gang gi tshe gnyen po ye shes ma skyes pas rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa ma log pa'i tshe ni 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po mi ldog ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyen po ye shes ma skyes pas rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa ma log pa'i tshe ni 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po mi ldog ste /
translated: As long as that is the case, the result—the mass of suffering—will not be reversed.

original: 'khor bar 'gyur ba de'i kun rdzob de ni 'khor ba yang yin la gang gi tshe gnyen po skyes par mi mthun pa'i phyogs las dang nyon mongs pa 'gags te 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'gyur ba de'i kun rdzob de ni 'khor ba yang yin la gang gi tshe gnyen po skyes par mi mthun pa'i phyogs las dang nyon mongs pa 'gags te 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po mi 'byung ste /
translated: But when the antidote arises, the opposing factors of karma and afflictions are stopped, and the resultant aggregates of suffering do not arise.

original: mi 'khor bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: mi 'khor bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni /
translated: At that time,

original: skye 'gag gi mtshan nyid kun rdzob yin yang 'khor ba ma yin pas nges pa med pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye 'gag gi mtshan nyid kun rdzob yin yang 'khor ba ma yin pas nges pa med pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: even though the conventional reality characterized by arising and cessation is samsara, it is not samsara.

original: yang rnal 'byor pa dag na re /🔽gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'di skad du khyod kyis gong du /
analyzed: yang rnal 'byor pa dag na re / gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di skad du khyod kyis gong du /
translated: The yogis say,🔽“When the mind is not engaged in the conventional,

original: don dam blo yi spyod yul min //
analyzed: don dam blo yi spyod yul min //
translated: at that time, what is the object of refutation?🔽What is the refuting agent?🔽What is the refutation?🔽What is the probandum?🔽What is the proof?🔽What is the one who proves?🔽What is the one who understands?🔽What is the one who does not understand?🔽What is the one who is liberated?🔽What is the one who is not liberated?🔽What is the one who is to be trained?🔽What is the one who trains?🔽What is the one who is to be purified?🔽What is the one who purifies?🔽What is the one who is to be attained?🔽What is the one who attains?🔽What is the one who is to be known?

original: blo dang sgra ni kun rdzob yin //
analyzed: blo dang sgra ni kun rdzob yin //
translated: What is the one who knows?🔽What is the one who is to be seen?🔽What is the one who sees?🔽What is the one who is to be realized?

original: zhes smras pas don dam pa sems nyid kyang ngo bo med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhes smras pas don dam pa sems nyid kyang ngo bo med pa nyid yin la /
translated: What is the one who realizes?🔽What is the one who is to be abandoned?🔽What is the one who abandons?🔽What is the one who is to be generated?🔽What is the one who generates?🔽What is the one who is to be purified?🔽What is the one who purifies?🔽What is the one who is to be attained?🔽What is the one who attains?🔽What is the one who is to be known?🔽What is the one who knows?🔽What is the one who is to be seen?🔽What is the one who sees?🔽What is the one who is to be realized?🔽What is the one who realizes?

original: yul ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod do zhes khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: yul ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod do zhes khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: What is the one who is to be abandoned?🔽What is the one who abandons?🔽What is the one who is to be generated?

original: de ni dam bcas pa la phan tshun 'gal ba'i skyon chags te /
analyzed: de ni dam bcas pa la phan tshun 'gal ba'i skyon chags te /
translated: This is the fault of mutual contradiction in your thesis.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi tshe shes pa nyid kyang don dam par med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa nyid kyang don dam par med pa yin na ni /
translated: If consciousness itself does not exist ultimately,

original: yul sgyu ma lta bu de shes pa gang la snang nas ji ltar @340b snang ba nyid du yod /
analyzed: yul sgyu ma lta bu de shes pa gang la snang nas ji ltar @340b snang ba nyid du yod /
translated: then what illusory object appears to what consciousness and how does it appear?🔽But if the object exists as it appears, then at that time the consciousness to which it appears also exists, so it is not tenable that consciousness is ultimate.

original: 'on te yul ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod na ni de'i tshe de gang la snang ba'i shes pa nyid kyang yod pas shes pa don dam pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na nyes pa 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs so snyam nas /
analyzed: 'on te yul ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod na ni de'i tshe de gang la snang ba'i shes pa nyid kyang yod pas shes pa don dam pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na nyes pa 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs so snyam nas /
translated: Since you Cittamātra assert that this fault is also similar for us,

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “When you say . . .”

original: khyod rnal 'byor spyod pa dag chos thams cad sems tsam nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe /🔽yul sgyu ma tsam yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyod rnal 'byor spyod pa dag chos thams cad sems tsam nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe / yul sgyu ma tsam yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: When you Yogācāra assert that all phenomena are mind only,🔽then it is not tenable that consciousness exists ultimately because even an illusory object does not exist.

original: shes pa don dam par yod par yang mi 'thad pa la yang gang gi tshe shes pa don dam par yod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: shes pa don dam par yod par yang mi 'thad pa la yang gang gi tshe shes pa don dam par yod pa yin na ni /
translated: When consciousness exists ultimately,

original: de'i tshe yul sgyu ma tsam yang med pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe yul sgyu ma tsam yang med pa mi 'thad de /
translated: At that time, it is untenable that there is not even an illusion-like object,🔽because consciousness depends on objects of consciousness.

original: shes pa ni shes bya la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir khyed la de yang nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa ni shes bya la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir khyed la de yang nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that to you,

original: ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “As long as there is consciousness,” and so on.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang /
translated: For example, an illusory person🔽is not ultimately existent due to the power of the assembly of conditions, but after the cessation of the previous moment, he is born again. In the same way, here also, since he is born, it is said that he is perfectly existent.

original: rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis don dam par med kyang snga ma 'gags pa'i rjes la yang skye ba de bzhin du 'dir yang de dang 'dra bas skye ba'i phyir yang dag par yod ces bya ba de ni ma nges pa'i don to snyam du bsam pa nyid do
analyzed: rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis don dam par med kyang snga ma 'gags pa'i rjes la yang skye ba de bzhin du 'dir yang de dang 'dra bas skye ba'i phyir yang dag par yod ces bya ba de ni ma nges pa'i don to snyam du bsam pa nyid do
translated: The meaning of that is uncertain.

original: // 'o na de ltar don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: // 'o na de ltar don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
translated: Well, if that is so, and he is ultimately without entityness,

original: de'i tshe lo brgya'am stong la sogs par yun ring du gnas par mi rung ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe lo brgya'am stong la sogs par yun ring du gnas par mi rung ba zhig na /
translated: then it is not suitable for him to endure for a long time, for a hundred or a thousand years, and so on.

original: de ltar ni sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni yun ring du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni yun ring du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
translated: Since the thing called a sentient being endures for a long time, he exists ultimately.

original: de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rgyun ring tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rgyun ring tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is also uncertain, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: res 'ga' sgyu ma'i skyes bu la yang sman dang sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis yun ring du gnas pa srid pa'i phyir des na yun ring du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir don dam par yod ces bya ba de yang ma nyes pa'i skyon chags pa nyid do
analyzed: res 'ga' sgyu ma'i skyes bu la yang sman dang sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis yun ring du gnas pa srid pa'i phyir des na yun ring du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir don dam par yod ces bya ba de yang ma nyes pa'i skyon chags pa nyid do
translated: Since it is possible that sometimes an illusory person endures for a long time due to the power of medicine, mantras, and so on, it is not the case that because something endures for a long time it exists ultimately.

original: snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: 'on te de ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du srog bcad pas sdig mi 'byung ba la thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du srog bcad pas sdig mi 'byung ba la thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If that is the case, then it follows that just like an illusory person, no sin arises from killing.

original: sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di ni srog bcad pa las sdig 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di ni srog bcad pa las sdig 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
translated: Since the sin of killing arises from killing this so-called sentient being, it exists ultimately.

original: de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is also uncertain,🔽Nāgārjuna explains:

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since it is possible that sometimes an illusory person is killed and sin arises, it is not the case that because sin arises from killing a sentient being, it exists ultimately.

original: 'di snyam du sdig pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sdig pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: One might think, Since sin occurs,

original: don dam par yod pa ni ma nges kyi /🔽'o na ci zhe na don dam par med kyang kun rdzob tu srog yod pa'i phyir de bsad pa dang ma @341a * //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ni ma nges kyi / 'o na ci zhe na don dam par med kyang kun rdzob tu srog yod pa'i phyir de bsad pa dang ma @341a * //
translated: it is not certain that it exists ultimately.

original: bsad pa'i rgyus ci rigs par phan gnod 'byung ba yin pas /
analyzed: bsad pa'i rgyus ci rigs par phan gnod 'byung ba yin pas /
translated: But if it does not exist ultimately, then since life exists conventionally, the cause of killing it and not killing it would be the cause of benefit and harm, respectively.

original: de bas na de bsad pa'i rgyus sdig pa 'byung ba yin zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bsad pa'i rgyus sdig pa 'byung ba yin zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one thinks, Sin occurs due to the cause of killing it.

original: 'o na de ltar sems can rnams sems yod pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar sems can rnams sems yod pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa yin gyi /
translated: One might say, Since sentient beings have minds, they exist ultimately.

original: gal te don dam par med pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te don dam par med pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If they did not exist ultimately,

original: sems nyid kyang 'byung du mi rung ste /
analyzed: sems nyid kyang 'byung du mi rung ste /
translated: the mind itself would not occur,

original: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like, for example, the illusory person.

original: don dam par med kyang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu sems 'byung bar mi 'gal te /
analyzed: don dam par med kyang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu sems 'byung bar mi 'gal te /
translated: It is not contradictory for the mind to occur conventionally due to the power of the assembly of conditions, even though it does not exist ultimately.

original: dper na sgyu ma de nyid don dam par med kyang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis rta dang glang po la sogs pa 'bras bu mi 'dra ba sna tshogs pa 'byung ba lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma de nyid don dam par med kyang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis rta dang glang po la sogs pa 'bras bu mi 'dra ba sna tshogs pa 'byung ba lta bu yin pas /
translated: For example, although that very illusion does not exist ultimately, due to the power of the assembly of conditions, various different effects such as horses, elephants, and so on arise.

original: de bas na khyod kyi sems can dang ldan par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na khyod kyi sems can dang ldan par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since you assert that sentient beings arise,

original: don dam par yod ces bya ba de yang ma nges pa nyid do snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: don dam par yod ces bya ba de yang ma nges pa nyid do snyam du bsams nas /
translated: that which is called “ultimately existent” is also uncertain.

original: sngags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thinking that, he said, “Mantras and so on,” and so forth.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what he taught.

original: sgyu ma'i rgyu rkyen sngags la sogs pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir sems dang mi ldan pa 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rgyu rkyen sngags la sogs pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir sems dang mi ldan pa 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Since the causes and conditions of an illusion, such as mantras and so on, are powerless, they arise without a mind.

original: don dam par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin la /
analyzed: don dam par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin la /
translated: However, they do not arise because they do not exist ultimately.

original: sems can rnams la ni rgyu rkyen la nus pa yod pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams la ni rgyu rkyen la nus pa yod pas /
translated: Since the causes and conditions of sentient beings are powerful,

original: sems dang ldan par 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sems dang ldan par 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: they arise with a mind.

original: don dam par yod pa'i phyir ni 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa'i phyir ni 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: However, they do not arise because they exist ultimately.

original: de bas na ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is uncertain.

original: 'on te sems can rnams la don dam par med kyang sems 'byung na ni /
analyzed: 'on te sems can rnams la don dam par med kyang sems 'byung na ni /
translated: But if the mind arises in regard to sentient beings, even though they do not exist ultimately,

original: de'i tshe khyad par med pa de bzhin du sgyu ma la yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyad par med pa de bzhin du sgyu ma la yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: then why does it not arise in regard to illusions, since there is no difference?

original: rgyu rkyen gyi nus pa mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gyi nus pa mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the power of causes and conditions is different.

original: de bas na sna tshogs rkyen las zhes bya ba la smos te /
analyzed: de bas na sna tshogs rkyen las zhes bya ba la smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “from various conditions,”

original: gal te rgyu rkyen gcig gis 'bras bu mtha' dag skyed nus pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu rkyen gcig gis 'bras bu mtha' dag skyed nus pa yin na ni /
translated: If a single cause and condition has the power to generate all effects,

original: de'i tshe sgyu ma la yang sems 'byung bar 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe sgyu ma la yang sems 'byung bar 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: then the mind would arise in regard to illusions,🔽but that is impossible.

original: de mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzhan gyi gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan gyi gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible.

original: yong lugs kyi don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhing bzlog nas kun rdzob ni 'khor ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: yong lugs kyi don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhing bzlog nas kun rdzob ni 'khor ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If you say, “The ultimate object of the way things are is nirvana, and the opposite of that is not the conventional of samsara itself.”

original: gang gi tshe byed dbu ma pas ji skad bshad pa ltar don dam par ni skye 'gag thams cad dang bral ba yin zhing bzlog nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byed dbu ma pas ji skad bshad pa ltar don dam par ni skye 'gag thams cad dang bral ba yin zhing bzlog nas /
translated: When the Madhyamika, the agent, is as has been explained, free from all arising and ceasing ultimately, and when, in the opposite sense,

original: skye 'gag gi mtshan nyid thams cad ni kun rdzob yin par grub pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: skye 'gag gi mtshan nyid thams cad ni kun rdzob yin par grub pa de lta na ni /
translated: all characteristics of arising and ceasing are established as being the superficial,

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyang gnyen po skye ba @341b dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun rdzob yin pas 'khor ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyang gnyen po skye ba @341b dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun rdzob yin pas 'khor ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then at that time, since even the Buddha is the superficial, characterized by the arising of the antidote and the cessation of the counterac-tive, it follows that he is in cyclic existence.

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes pa /
translated: Therefore, the practice of enlightenment would be meaningless.

original: nges pa med de skye 'gag phan tshun 'gal zhing skyon 'di 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nges pa med de skye 'gag phan tshun 'gal zhing skyon 'di 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: This is not certain, because arising and ceasing are mutually exclusive, and this fault would occur.

original: gang gi tshe kho bo la ni shes pa don dam par med kyang sgyu ma tsam du gnas pa de la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho bo la ni shes pa don dam par med kyang sgyu ma tsam du gnas pa de la /
translated: But when we maintain that consciousness does not exist ultimately, but is present as mere illusion,

original: yul sgyu ma de lta bu snang ba'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul sgyu ma de lta bu snang ba'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then, since the illusory object appears in that way, there is no fault. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan gyi phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa de nyid las ma grol ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa de nyid las ma grol ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the opponent is not free from the fault of mutual contradiction,

original: gang tshe sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “When the mind itself appears as an object,” and so on.

original: de ltar yul dang sems gnyi ga sgyu ma nyid du khas len na ni /
analyzed: de ltar yul dang sems gnyi ga sgyu ma nyid du khas len na ni /
translated: If one accepts that both the object and the mind are illusions,

original: gnyi ga yang don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir /
translated: then since both are ultimately essenceless,

original: gang zhig gang la snang ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la snang ste /
translated: what is what?

original: de lta bas na yul ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod pa shin tu yang mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na yul ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod pa shin tu yang mi 'thad pas /
translated: Therefore, it is completely untenable that objects exist as they appear.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa so na gnas la /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa so na gnas la /
translated: The fault of mutual contradiction remains.

original: kho bo cag ni yul sgyu ma tsam 'di med kyang rang rig pa'i sgo nas shes pa nyid du khas len pas dam bcas pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa mi mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni yul sgyu ma tsam 'di med kyang rang rig pa'i sgo nas shes pa nyid du khas len pas dam bcas pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa mi mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: You may say, “We do not have the fault of mutual contradiction in our assertions, because although we accept that this mere illusory object does not exist, we accept consciousness as reflexive awareness.”

original: slob dpon gyis nyes pa de nyid so na gnas par sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis nyes pa de nyid so na gnas par sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the fault remains,

original: ral gri so ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ral gri so ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the master says, “The edge of a sword,” and so on.

original: ji ltar ral gri'i so de nyid la gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa gnyis med pa'i phyir /🔽rang gis rang mi gcod pa bzhin du shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang rig bya dang rig byed gnyis med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar ral gri'i so de nyid la gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa gnyis med pa'i phyir / rang gis rang mi gcod pa bzhin du shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang rig bya dang rig byed gnyis med pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the edge of a sword does not cut itself because there is no cutting agent and something to be cut in relation to it,

original: rang gis rang rig pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rang gis rang rig pa mi 'thad de /
translated: so too the nature of consciousness is not tenable as reflexive awareness because there is no object of awareness and awareness in relation to it.

original: de bas na yul khas mi len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na yul khas mi len pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the object is not accepted,

original: shes pa don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i nyes pa so na gnas la /
analyzed: shes pa don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i nyes pa so na gnas la /
translated: the fault that consciousness is untenable as ultimately existent remains.

original: gang gi tshe sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba 'dis ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du thams cad du med pa'i don ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba 'dis ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du thams cad du med pa'i don ni ma yin gyi /
translated: When it is said that things are illusionlike, this does not mean that they are nonexistent in every respect, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: snang du zin kyang don dam par med pa'i don yin pas /
analyzed: snang du zin kyang don dam par med pa'i don yin pas /
translated: It means that even though they appear, they do not exist ultimately.

original: de bas na yul dang shes par gnyi ga don dam par med kyang snang tshod tsam du yod pa yin pa'i phyir yul sgyu ma lta bu de la ji lta ba bzhin du yod pas /
analyzed: de bas na yul dang shes par gnyi ga don dam par med kyang snang tshod tsam du yod pa yin pa'i phyir yul sgyu ma lta bu de la ji lta ba bzhin du yod pas /
translated: Therefore, although neither objects nor consciousness exist ultimately, they do exist in terms of mere appearances.

original: nyes pa so na gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes pa so na gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that the fault does not remain.

original: yang gzhan gyis zhes pa gcig po de la rig bya dang rig byed gnyis kyi bdag nyid ma grub kyang /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyis zhes pa gcig po de la rig bya dang rig byed gnyis kyi bdag nyid ma grub kyang /
translated: Moreover, in the case of the single word “other,” the identity of the object of awareness and the act of awareness is not established.

original: rang rig pa nyid du gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /🔽gal te mar me zhes @342a * //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid du gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir / gal te mar me zhes @342a * //
translated: However, because it is the basis of the treatise,

original: bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “Just as a lamp,” and so on.

original: ji ltar mar me rang gi ngo bo la rang gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal bar byed pa gnyis ma grub kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me rang gi ngo bo la rang gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal bar byed pa gnyis ma grub kyang /
translated: Just as a lamp does not have the two aspects of illuminating itself and illuminating something else,

original: gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen nyi ma la sogs pa gzhan la mi ltos par gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen nyi ma la sogs pa gzhan la mi ltos par gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: it is not dependent on other conditions, such as the sun, for its nature of illumination. Therefore, it illuminates itself.

original: shes pa gsal bar yang rig par bya ba dang / rig par byed pa gnyis med kyang /
analyzed: shes pa gsal bar yang rig par bya ba dang / rig par byed pa gnyis med kyang /
translated: In the same way, consciousness, which is clear, does not have the two aspects of being aware of itself and being aware of something else.

original: rig byed gzhan la mi ltos par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i tshul gyis rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig byed gzhan la mi ltos par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i tshul gyis rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because it is not dependent on other objects of awareness, it is reflexive awareness in the sense that it is by nature aware.

original: yul sgyu ma tsam med du zin kyang shes pa don dam par yod pa 'gal ba med do zhe na /🔽slob dpon gyis dpe nyid ma grub pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: yul sgyu ma tsam med du zin kyang shes pa don dam par yod pa 'gal ba med do zhe na / slob dpon gyis dpe nyid ma grub pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Even if the mere object of illusion does not exist, it is not contradictory for consciousness to exist ultimately.

original: de mi 'thad par sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi 'thad par sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The master [Nāgārjuna] states the following in order to establish that this is untenable by way of the nonestablishment of the example.

original: mar me gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mar me gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: A lamp does not illuminate itself, and so on.

original: gal te mar me de gsal ba'i rang bzhin du khas len na ni /
analyzed: gal te mar me de gsal ba'i rang bzhin du khas len na ni /
translated: If one accepts that a lamp has the nature of illumination,

original: de'i tshe rang gis gsal par byed pa shin tu yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gis gsal par byed pa shin tu yang mi 'thad de /
translated: then it is utterly untenable that it illuminates itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gis rang gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gis rang gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no need for it to illuminate itself.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mun pas bsgribs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi gsal ba med pa la /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mun pas bsgribs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi gsal ba med pa la /
translated: Because it has the nature of illumination, it is not nonilluminated, which is characterized by being obscured by darkness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis rang gsal bar bya mi dgos pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis rang gsal bar bya mi dgos pas /
translated: For that very reason, there is no need for it to illuminate itself.

original: rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as it does not illuminate itself,

original: 'dir shes pa yang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir shes pa yang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: here consciousness also does not illuminate itself because it has the nature of awareness.

original: ma rig pa'i cha shas med la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i cha shas med la /
translated: and it is devoid of the aspect of ignorance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis rang rig par bya mi dgos pas rang gis rang rig par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis rang rig par bya mi dgos pas rang gis rang rig par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: And for that very reason, it does not need to be made self-aware, and so it is not self-aware.

original: de bas na rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir shes pa rang gis rang rig par byed do zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi gtan tshigs 'di la 'gal ba'i skyon chags pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir shes pa rang gis rang rig par byed do zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi gtan tshigs 'di la 'gal ba'i skyon chags pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the reason you gave, “because it is the nature of consciousness,” is faulty, because it is contradictory.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /🔽gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste / gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Now we will explain the meaning of the parts of the verse.🔽“It does not illuminate itself” means

original: rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “it does not illuminate itself.”

original: gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not need to be illuminated.

original: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mun gyis bsgribs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gsal ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mun gyis bsgribs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gsal ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not nonilluminated due to being obscured by darkness.

original: de gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is the nature of illumination.

original: sngon po dag ni mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: sngon po dag ni mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: Blue is a concordant example.

original: de bzhin du bee d'urya bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bee d'urya bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, it is like beryl.

original: shel lta bu zhes bya ba ni sngon po de nyid kyi mi mthun @342b pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: shel lta bu zhes bya ba ni sngon po de nyid kyi mi mthun @342b pa'i dpe ste /
translated: “Like crystal” is an example that is discordant with that blue.

original: ji ltar shel ni rang bzhin gyis sngon po ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar shel ni rang bzhin gyis sngon po ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because crystal is not blue by nature,

original: sngon po ma yin pa'i rkyen bee d'urya la sogs pa la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa'i rkyen bee d'urya la sogs pa la ltos pa yin la /
translated: it depends on conditions that are not blue, such as beryl.

original: bee d'urya sngon po nyid ni sngon po'i rgyu la mi ltos te /
analyzed: bee d'urya sngon po nyid ni sngon po'i rgyu la mi ltos te /
translated: Beryl’s blueness does not depend on a cause of blue.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dang po nas sngon po nyid du 'dug pa yin pa'i phyir de lta bu'i bee d'urya sngon po de rang la rang gis sngon por byed de /
analyzed: dang po nas sngon po nyid du 'dug pa yin pa'i phyir de lta bu'i bee d'urya sngon po de rang la rang gis sngon por byed de /
translated: Because it exists as blue from the beginning. Such blue beryl is blue by itself.

original: sngon por bya mi dgos pa'i phyir rang la sngon bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon por bya mi dgos pa'i phyir rang la sngon bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not need to be made blue. It is like crystal itself.

original: yang gzhan gyis shes pa rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyis shes pa rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to prove that consciousness is reflexive awareness,

original: rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the root text says, “Other conditions . . . ” and so on.

original: de ltar rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang rig par byed ces bya ba mi 'thad du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang rig par byed ces bya ba mi 'thad du zin kyang /
translated: Thus, although it is untenable to say that consciousness is reflexive awareness because it is the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: yul gzugs dang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis shes pa de rang rig par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: yul gzugs dang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis shes pa de rang rig par byed do zhe na /
translated: you may say that consciousness is reflexive awareness by the power of other conditions, such as the object, form, and the eye faculty.

original: khyed kyi lugs kyis chos thams cad sems tsam du 'dus pa yin pas sems las ma gtogs rkyen gzhan nyid ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs kyis chos thams cad sems tsam du 'dus pa yin pas sems las ma gtogs rkyen gzhan nyid ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
translated: In your system, all phenomena are included in mind only. Therefore, since you do not establish any other conditions apart from the mind,

original: rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis kyang shes pa de rang rig par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis kyang shes pa de rang rig par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is untenable to say that consciousness is reflexive awareness by the power of other conditions.🔽To demonstrate this, the text says:

original: gzugs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzugs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Form” and so on.

original: de ltar gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma'i sgo nas shes pa don dam par yod pa nyid mi 'thad par bsgrubs nas da ni shes pa don dam par yod pa la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma'i sgo nas shes pa don dam par yod pa nyid mi 'thad par bsgrubs nas da ni shes pa don dam par yod pa la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus established that it is untenable for consciousness to exist ultimately by means of a refutation through valid forms of cognition, the text now explains that there are no valid forms of cognition that can establish the ultimate existence of consciousness.

original: mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽mar me gsal bar byed pa yin par ni dbang po'i mngon sum gyi blos nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / mar me gsal bar byed pa yin par ni dbang po'i mngon sum gyi blos nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
translated: The response to that is stated by “A lamp, etc.”

original: khas len par rigs na /
analyzed: khas len par rigs na /
translated: Since the illumination of a lamp is experienced by the mind of sense direct perception, it is reasonable to accept it.

original: shes pa rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa mngon sum du tshad ma gang gis kyang ma grub pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas blangs par mi rigs so snyam du bsam pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa mngon sum du tshad ma gang gis kyang ma grub pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas blangs par mi rigs so snyam du bsam pa ste /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas len pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas len pa ni /

analyzed: re zhig yid dang dbang po'i mngon sum gyis ni mi grub ste /

analyzed: de gnyis kyi yul ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa gzugs can gyi skye mched lnga yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The objects of those two are the five physical sense bases, such as form and sound.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum @343a * //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum @343a * //
translated: The direct perception of reflexive awareness.🔽🔽

original: gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
translated: It is not established by reflexive awareness either,🔽because that is the occasion for analysis.

original: de nyid ni gzod dpyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor gyis mngon sum gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni gzod dpyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor gyis mngon sum gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
translated: It is not established by yogic direct perception either,

original: chu rol mthong ba rnams la rnal 'byor gyis tha snyad mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu rol mthong ba rnams la rnal 'byor gyis tha snyad mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bas na rang gis rang gsal bar byed kyang rung mi byed kyang rung ste /

original: mngon sum gyi tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not established by the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: dam bcas kyang mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam bcas kyang mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The point is that the thesis is not established.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis ma grub kyang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pas 'grub po snyam nas /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis ma grub kyang 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pas 'grub po snyam nas /
translated: If you think that although it is not established by direct perception, it is established by inference arisen from the effect-evidence,

original: gal te rang rig ces bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gal te rang rig ces bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna says, If reflexive awareness does not exist, etc.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba'i rang rig pa med na phyis kyang dran pa skye ba'i rang rig pa zhig yod la rjes su dpag pas 'grub po snyam pa la /

translated: If there were no autocognition that experiences such things as pleasure, then later on there would be no autocognition that gives rise to memory.

original: don dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: dran pa'i shes pa skye ba'i sgo nas rang rig pa'i shes pa don dam pa zhig sgrub mi dgos te /
analyzed: dran pa'i shes pa skye ba'i sgo nas rang rig pa'i shes pa don dam pa zhig sgrub mi dgos te /
translated: It is not necessary to prove the existence of an ultimate autocognition on the basis of the arising of a memory consciousness.

original: gong du ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang rig pa don dam pa de ni grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa'o //🔽'on te rang rig pa don dam pa de yod pa de nyid du ma grub pa ni phyis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba mi 'thad do zhe na /

translated: The idea is that autocognition in the ultimate sense has been established in the manner explained above.🔽If you think that it is not tenable for a later memory consciousness to arise if the existence of that ultimate autocognition is not established,

original: don dam pa med kyang rang rig pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'i dbang gis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir de dran no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam pa med kyang rang rig pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'i dbang gis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir de dran no zhes gsungs so //

original: 'on te kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But it is not tenable that they exist conventionally.

original: rang bzhin med par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin med par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because you accept that they are essenceless.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa kun rdzob pa ni 'dir mi 'gog pa'i phyir dang / 'o na 'dir ci zhig 'gog snyam pa la 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'dir ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu dngos por zhen pa dgag pa'i phyir rang bzhin 'gog go snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa kun rdzob pa ni 'dir mi 'gog pa'i phyir dang / 'o na 'dir ci zhig 'gog snyam pa la 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dir ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu dngos por zhen pa dgag pa'i phyir rang bzhin 'gog go snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: In response to this, he says, “In this way . . .

analyzed: da ni yul bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dri ba'i tshig bkod de /
translated: Now, in order to teach the yogi’s meditation on emptiness that focuses on the two truths, the question is posed with the words “like an illusion,” and so on.

original: gzhan dag 'di snyam du stong pa nyid du shes pa ni sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis bsgom par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'di snyam du stong pa nyid du shes pa ni sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis bsgom par mi bya ste /
translated: Others think that because the knowledge of emptiness is not the cause for eliminating obscurations, those who are rational should not cultivate it,🔽just like magicians and so on.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan @343b la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /🔽de byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan @343b la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du sems na / de byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to that, it is said:

original: yang zhen pa 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: yang zhen pa 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
translated: The cause for the arising of attachment is twofold:

original: nang gi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma spangs pa phyi rol na brtag par bya ba'i yul nye bar gyur pa yin pa las sgyu ma mkhan la ni de gnyis ka dang ldan pa'i phyir re zhig ma brtags pa'i tshe zhen pa skye ba
analyzed: nang gi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma spangs pa phyi rol na brtag par bya ba'i yul nye bar gyur pa yin pa las sgyu ma mkhan la ni de gnyis ka dang ldan pa'i phyir re zhig ma brtags pa'i tshe zhen pa skye ba
translated: the non-abandonment of the internal improper mentation and the presence of external objects to be investigated. Since magicians possess both of those, it is reasonable that attachment arises when they have not yet investigated.

original: ni rigs pa yin na gang gi tshe /
analyzed: ni rigs pa yin na gang gi tshe /
translated: But when

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa chen po bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi bar du stong pa nyid la goms par byas pas ni /
translated: great yogis have become familiar with emptiness for three measureless eons,

original: dngos por zhen pa'i bag chags spong bas /
analyzed: dngos por zhen pa'i bag chags spong bas /
translated: they abandon the latent tendencies for attachment to entities.

original: chos thams cad lag mthil du skyu ru ra'i 'bru bzhag pa bzhin du gzigs kyang zhen pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: chos thams cad lag mthil du skyu ru ra'i 'bru bzhag pa bzhin du gzigs kyang zhen pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bas /
translated: Although he sees all phenomena as clearly as a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand, he is not attached to them, and thus afflictions do not arise.

analyzed: de bas na sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that one should cultivate the yoga of emptiness because it is the cause for eliminating obscurations.

original: 'o na stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bsgom par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bsgom par bya snyam pa la /
translated: Well then, how should one cultivate the yoga of emptiness?

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽re zhig gcig dang du ma la sogs pa dang bral ba'i spyod pa'i gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / re zhig gcig dang du ma la sogs pa dang bral ba'i spyod pa'i gang gi tshe /
translated: The verse beginning “When” and so on is stated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po gang zhig med do zhes brtag cing dgag par bya ba'i dngos po yod pa cung zad kyang ma rnyed pa'i dus de'i tshe yod pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po gang zhig med do zhes brtag cing dgag par bya ba'i dngos po yod pa cung zad kyang ma rnyed pa'i dus de'i tshe yod pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung la /
translated: First, when one is free from the conduct of singularity, multiplicity, and so on, at that time, one does not find even the slightest existent thing that is to be examined and refuted, such as “form does not exist.” At that time, the manifest clinging to existence does not arise.

analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga rnal 'byor pa'i blo'i mdun na mi gnas te /

analyzed: gzung ba'i cha las mi ldan pa'i dus de'i tshe /
translated: at that time, when the aspect of the apprehended does not exist,

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gsum pa ni med pa'i phyir / cir yang dmigs pa med pa'i sgo nas /
translated: because there is no third alternative,🔽all conceptual thoughts are completely pacified,

analyzed: rtog pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: in terms of the nonapprehension of anything whatsoever.

analyzed: 'on te de ltar rtog pa mi mnga' na gdul bya rnams la sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi skur snang ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But if the Buddha does not have conceptual thoughts in that way, it is not tenable that the form body of the Buddha appears to disciples.

translated: It is not contradictory for the Buddha to act for the sake of sentient beings, even though he has no conceptual thought, because of the momentum of his former aspirational prayers.

original: yid bzhin nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lding gi mchod sdong dang 'dra'o snyam nas ;
translated: Thinking this, he said, Like the wish-fulfilling gem, etc.🔽Well then, if the Buddha is indeed devoid of conceptual thought, it is contradictory to say that he acts for the sake of sentient beings.🔽It is not contradictory for the Buddha to act for the sake of sentient beings, even though he has no conceptual thought, because of the momentum of his former aspirational prayers.

original: mchod sdong grub pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mchod sdong grub pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thinking this, he said, Like the wish-fulfilling gem

analyzed: rmi lam gyi don la sogs pa yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin khas len pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: de bas na dpe yid bzhin nor bu dang / dpag bsam gyi shing dang / mchod sdong la sogs pa yang rtog pa med pa bzhin no //

analyzed: da ni mtshungs pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir khyed kyi gzhung gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa @344b gsungs te /

analyzed: mtshungs so snyam du bsam pa'o //
