original: de la yid ches te 'grub na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'di skad du kho bo cag gzhung de la sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du yid ches pa'i man ngag brgyud pas grub po snyam nas /
analyzed: de la yid ches te 'grub na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'di skad du kho bo cag gzhung de la sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du yid ches pa'i man ngag brgyud pas grub po snyam nas /
translated: If you say, “We are established because we have confidence in them,” the opponents might say, “We are established because we have confidence in the transmission that those scriptures are the Buddha’s word.”

original: theg pa chen po la yang yid ches kyi zhes bya ba theg pa chen po la yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du yid ches pa man ngag brgyud pa las grub pa la grub pa nyid du shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //🔽gnyi ga 'dod pa bden na ni zhes bya ba ni /🔽gal te pha rol 'di snyam du sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du yid ches par gzhag pa la ni khyed dang 'u bu cag gnyis kas 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang yid ches kyi zhes bya ba theg pa chen po la yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du yid ches pa man ngag brgyud pa las grub pa la grub pa nyid du shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to // gnyi ga 'dod pa bden na ni zhes bya ba ni / gal te pha rol 'di snyam du sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du yid ches par gzhag pa la ni khyed dang 'u bu cag gnyis kas 'dod pa yin na /
translated: The meaning of the statement “one should know that it is established by the lineage of oral instructions” is that it is established by the lineage of oral instructions.🔽If both parties accept that it is the word of the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid bden pa nyid du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid bden pa nyid du /
translated: then the opponent might think, “Both you and I accept that it is the word of the Buddha.

original: theg pa chen po ni kho bo cag gis mi 'dod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du bden pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni kho bo cag gis mi 'dod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du bden pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha because we do not accept it as the word of the Buddha.”

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe rig byed rnams kyang bden par 'gyur zhes pha ni rig byed kyi tshig rnams kyang dug la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas gnyis kas 'dod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe rig byed rnams kyang bden par 'gyur zhes pha ni rig byed kyi tshig rnams kyang dug la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas gnyis kas 'dod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: But if that is so, then the Vedas would be true, because both you and we accept that the words of the Vedas have the power to pacify poison and so on, and it would follow that the Vedas are the word of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gnyi ga 'dod pa zhes bya ba nyid ni rigs par 'thad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gnyi ga 'dod pa zhes bya ba nyid ni rigs par 'thad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not logical to accept both that the Vedas are the word of the Buddha and that they are not the word of the Buddha.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni mdo sde la 'jug 'dul ba la snang /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni mdo sde la 'jug 'dul ba la snang /
translated: If you posit that the Vedas are the word of the Buddha because they are included in the sūtras, they appear in the vinaya,

original: mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya ba yin na theg pa chen po ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya ba yin na theg pa chen po ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: and they are not inconsistent with the characteristics of the Buddha’s teachings, the Mahāyāna is not like that.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it not like that?

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lung las ni bsags pa la sogs pa nyid du yod par gsungs la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lung las ni bsags pa la sogs pa nyid du yod par gsungs la /
translated: The scriptures of the Śrāvaka Vehicle state that the aggregates and so on exist.

original: theg pa chen po las ni bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las ni bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Mahāyāna refutes that.

original: de lta bas na mdo sde dang 'gal bas sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya ba bsams nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na mdo sde dang 'gal bas sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes bya ba bsams nas /
translated: Therefore, since it contradicts the sutras, it is not the word of the Buddha.

original: gal te phan tshun 'gal zhe na //🔽zhes bya ba smras so //🔽'on te de ltar phan tshun mi mthun pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun 'gal zhe na // zhes bya ba smras so // 'on te de ltar phan tshun mi mthun pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe /
translated: If you say they contradict each other,🔽then you should abandon the Vinaya, the moon, and so on.

original: 'dul ba zla sogs pa dor dgos so zhes bya ba khyed nyan thos kyi lung las kyang phan @345a * //🔽tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dul ba zla sogs pa dor dgos so zhes bya ba khyed nyan thos kyi lung las kyang phan @345a * // tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that mere mutual contradiction does not make something not the word of the Buddha, then you should abandon the sutras of the śrāvakas, because they also contradict each other.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes dor dgos pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin no zhes dor dgos pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that you should abandon them because they are not the word of the Buddha.

original: 'on te de ni sems can mos pa mi mthun pa rnams dga' bar bya ba'i don du gsungs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni sems can mos pa mi mthun pa rnams dga' bar bya ba'i don du gsungs pa'i phyir na /
translated: If you say that the Vinaya and so on were taught in order to please sentient beings with different inclinations,

original: mi mthun pa yin yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa yin yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: then it is not contradictory for them to be the word of the Buddha even though they are mutually contradictory.

original: 'o na kho bo cag la yang mtshungs so snyam nas /
analyzed: 'o na kho bo cag la yang mtshungs so snyam nas /
translated: We think that is the same for us.

original: sems can mi mthun dgag bya'i phyir gsungs pa //
analyzed: sems can mi mthun dgag bya'i phyir gsungs pa //
translated: Because of the prohibition of sentient beings’ disagreement.

original: zhes bya ba de theg pa chen po'i lung la yang mi 'dod dam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de theg pa chen po'i lung la yang mi 'dod dam /
translated: Is that not accepted even in the scriptures of the Great Vehicle?

original: de yang sems can mos pa mi mthun pa rnams drang bar bya ba'i don du gsungs pa yin pas nyan thos kyi lung mi mthun pa yin yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang sems can mos pa mi mthun pa rnams drang bar bya ba'i don du gsungs pa yin pas nyan thos kyi lung mi mthun pa yin yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is also stated for the purpose of guiding sentient beings with different interests. Therefore, even though the scriptures of the Disciples are not in agreement, it is not contradictory that they are the word of the Buddha.

original: de ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To summarize this, he says, “Thus, etc.”

original: sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin pa nyid du'o //
translated: “Refutation” means that they are not the word of the Buddha.

original: the tshom med par zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin nam ma yin zhes bya ba'i the tshom mo //🔽de ni las dang po pa dag stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor bsgom pa la mi skrag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom med par zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin nam ma yin zhes bya ba'i the tshom mo // de ni las dang po pa dag stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor bsgom pa la mi skrag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: “Without doubt” means the doubt, “Are they or are they not the word of the Buddha?”

original: sdug bsngal bskyed dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bskyed dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To show that beginners should not be afraid of cultivating the yoga of emptiness, he says, “The cause of suffering, etc.”

original: stong nyid 'jigs pa zhi byed na //
analyzed: stong nyid 'jigs pa zhi byed na //
translated: If emptiness pacifies all fears,

original: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa'i rgyu yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa'i rgyu yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that if it is the cause for the pacification of suffering.

original: da ni gang 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i bdag ces bya ba ma grub pas /
analyzed: da ni gang 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i bdag ces bya ba ma grub pas /
translated: Now, since the so-called self, which is the object of fear, is not established,🔽it is taught that one should not fear the cultivation of emptiness.🔽To this end, he says,🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who goes to the next world?

original: stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ba la 'jigs par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ba la 'jigs par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If the self does not exist,🔽who experiences the result of action?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽whose is this clinging to “I”?

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If the self does not exist,🔽who is there to be liberated?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who goes to the next world?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who experiences the result of action?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽whose is this clinging to “I”?

original: bdag gi ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: bdag gi ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: If the self does not exist,🔽who is there to be liberated?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who goes to the next world?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who experiences the result of action?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽whose is this clinging to “I”?

original: re zhig gzugs bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽so dang skra sen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: re zhig gzugs bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir / so dang skra sen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the self does not exist,🔽who is there to be liberated?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who goes to the next world?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who experiences the result of action?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽whose is this clinging to “I”?

original: de dag ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: If the self does not exist,🔽who is there to be liberated?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who goes to the next world?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who experiences the result of action?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽whose is this clinging to “I”?

original: bdag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the self does not exist,🔽who is there to be liberated?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who goes to the next world?🔽If the self does not exist,

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: who experiences the result of action?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽whose is this clinging to “I”?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽who is there to be liberated?

original: so la sogs pa de dag ni mi rtag pa du ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni rtag pa gcig bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so la sogs pa de dag ni mi rtag pa du ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni rtag pa gcig bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the self does not exist,🔽who goes to the next world?

original: gal te de dag yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de dag yin na ni /
translated: If the self does not exist,🔽who experiences the result of action?🔽If the self does not exist,🔽whose is this clinging to “I”?🔽If the self does not exist

original: de dag kyang bdag bzhin du rtag pa dang gcig pu nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag bzhin du rtag pa dang gcig pu nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Moreover, they would be permanent and singular, just like the self.

original: yang na ni bdag kyang mi rtag pa du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ni bdag kyang mi rtag pa du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it follows that the self is impermanent and multiple.

original: da ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po bdag ma yin par bstan @345b pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po bdag ma yin par bstan @345b pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the consciousness aggregate is not the self,

original: rnam kun du rnam shes drug ni bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam kun du rnam shes drug ni bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “In every way, the six consciousnesses are not the self.”

original: de dag ni yul gzugs la sogs pa rnams la so sor 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni yul gzugs la sogs pa rnams la so sor 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: They are the individual apprehenders of objects such as form.

original: bdag ni thams cad la 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag ni thams cad la 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: The self is the apprehender of all.

original: de dag kyang bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not the self.

original: gal te yin na ni de dag kyang bdag bzhin du re res kyang yul thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni de dag kyang bdag bzhin du re res kyang yul thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If they were, it would follow that each of them would apprehend all objects, just as the self does.

original: yang na ni bdag kyang de bzhin du yul re re la 'dzin gyi thams cad mi 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ni bdag kyang de bzhin du yul re re la 'dzin gyi thams cad mi 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it follows that the self would apprehend each object, but not all of them, just as they do.

original: da ni yid bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yid bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the mind is not the self,🔽he says,

original: gal te yid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the mind is the self, then the self would be impermanent.

original: yid ni 'gags ma thag pa yin pas /
analyzed: yid ni 'gags ma thag pa yin pas /
translated: The mind is the immediately preceding cessation,

original: da ltar med pa yin la /
analyzed: da ltar med pa yin la /
translated: and it does not exist in the present.

original: bdag ni rtag pa yin pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa yin pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the self is permanent and exists in the present.

original: gal te yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni /
translated: If it were,

original: bdag bzhin du yid kyang da ltar yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag bzhin du yid kyang da ltar yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then, like the self, the mind would also exist in the present.

original: yid kyi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yid kyi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The characteristics of the mind would be impaired,

original: yang na ni yid bzhin du bdag kyang de ltar med pas bdag gi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ni yid bzhin du bdag kyang de ltar med pas bdag gi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or, like the mind, the self would not exist in that way, and the characteristics of the self would be impaired.

original: da ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'on te ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir / 'on te ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the future mind is not the self,🔽he says, “But if you say that the future mind is the self, then the self would be nonexistent.”

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems ma byung bas de ltar med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems ma byung bas de ltar med pa yin zhing /
translated: The future mind is not yet arisen, and thus it does not exist in that way.

original: bdag ni rtag pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the self is permanent and exists in the present.

original: gal te yin na ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems bzhin bdag kyang da ltar med par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems bzhin bdag kyang da ltar med par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were, then, like the future mind, the self would not exist in the present.

original: yang na bdag bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i sems da ltar yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bdag bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i sems da ltar yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it follows that the future mind, like the self, would exist in the present.

original: da ni de ltar ba'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gal te bum sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni de ltar ba'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir / gal te bum sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the present mind is not the self,🔽he says, “If the mind that thinks ‘I am’ is the self,” and so on.

original: gal te da ltar gyi dus su bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sems de bdag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da ltar gyi dus su bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sems de bdag yin no zhe na /
translated: If the mind that apprehends the self in the present is the self,

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: de ni yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the subject.

original: gal te yin na de bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sems yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te yin na de bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sems yin par mi rung ste /
translated: If it were the self, it would not be tenable that it is the mind that apprehends the self,

original: yul gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /🔽dper na bum pa yin na bum pa la 'dzin pa'i sems yin par mi rung ba bzhin nam /
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te / dper na bum pa yin na bum pa la 'dzin pa'i sems yin par mi rung ba bzhin nam /
translated: because it would be the nature of the object.🔽For example, if it is a pot, it is not tenable that it is the mind that apprehends the pot.

original: bum pa la 'dzin pa'i sems yin na bum pa yin par mi rung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa la 'dzin pa'i sems yin na bum pa yin par mi rung ba bzhin no //
translated: Or if it is the mind that apprehends the pot, it is not tenable that it is a pot.

original: da ni 'das pa'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i @346a * //
analyzed: da ni 'das pa'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i @346a * //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the past mind is not the self,

original: phyir ; gal te byung ba sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyir ; gal te byung ba sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If the mind that has arisen and ceased is the self,” and so on.

original: 'das pa'i sems ni 'gags nas med pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni rtag pa yin pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems ni 'gags nas med pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni rtag pa yin pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the past mind is ceased and does not exist, and because the self exists in the present, since it is permanent.

original: gal te yin na ni 'das pa'i sems bzhin du bdag kyang 'gags nas med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni 'das pa'i sems bzhin du bdag kyang 'gags nas med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were, then like the past mind, the self would also cease and not exist.

original: yang na ni bdag bzhin du 'das pa'i sems kyang da ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yang na ni bdag bzhin du 'das pa'i sems kyang da ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: Or else, like the self, the past mind would also exist in the present.

original: de gnyis kyi so so'i mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi so so'i mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the individual characteristics of those two would be impaired.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po bdag ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po bdag ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus demonstrated that the aggregate of consciousness is not the self,

original: da ni khams bco brgyad bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni khams bco brgyad bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that the eighteen constituents are not the self,

original: gal te bdag mig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te bdag mig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If the self were the eye,” and so on.

original: mig gi khams ni gzugs la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi khams ni gzugs la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin gyi /
translated: The eye constituent apprehends form and so on,

original: sgra la sogs pa gzhan yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa gzhan yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but does not apprehend sound and so on, because it is not the apprehender of other things, and because the self is the apprehender of all.

original: de lta ma yin gyi mig gi khams bzhin du bdag gis kyang sgra mi thos par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin gyi mig gi khams bzhin du bdag gis kyang sgra mi thos par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were not so, then like the eye element, the self would not hear sound,

original: yang na ni bdag bzhin du mig gi khams kyis kyang thams cad 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ni bdag bzhin du mig gi khams kyis kyang thams cad 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or else, like the self, the eye element would also come to apprehend everything.

original: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa dang / so so'i mtshan nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba bzlog na /
analyzed: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa dang / so so'i mtshan nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba bzlog na /
translated: The reason “because their characteristics are not similar, like the eye element” is correct, and the consequence of the loss of their individual characteristics is reversed.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad mas ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad mas ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The valid cognition that contradicts this should be applied as appropriate.

original: nga ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: nga ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
translated: The self is the aggregate of formation conjoined with feeling and discernment.

original: dngos su sems las byung ba rnams bdag ma yin par bstan pa ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos su sems las byung ba rnams bdag ma yin par bstan pa ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the mental factors are not actually the self,

original: de bzhin du bden min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bden min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “It is not true that the self is feeling, etc.”

original: bde ba ni bde bar nyams su myong gi / sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su mi myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba ni bde bar nyams su myong gi / sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su mi myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because pleasure is experienced as pleasure, and pain, etc. are not experienced.

original: tshor ba bde ba ni bdag ma yin te /🔽gal te yin na bdag bzhin tshor ba bde bas kyang thams cad nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba ni bdag ma yin te / gal te yin na bdag bzhin tshor ba bde bas kyang thams cad nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The pleasant feeling is not the self,🔽because if it were, it would follow, absurdly, that just as the self is, so the pleasant feeling would experience everything,

original: yang na tshor ba bde ba bzhin du bdag gis kyang bde ba 'ba' zhig kyang nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na tshor ba bde ba bzhin du bdag gis kyang bde ba 'ba' zhig kyang nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or, just as the pleasant feeling is, so the self would experience only pleasure.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa gzhan dag la ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa gzhan dag la ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the other feelings, such as pain, etc., as is appropriate.

original: da ni skabs kyi don gyis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skabs kyi don gyis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to conclude the topic at hand,

original: @346b de ltar bdag tu rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: @346b de ltar bdag tu rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Thus, that which is suitable as the self,” and so on.

original: da ni mu stegs grangs can pas bdag sems pa yod pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa dang / bye brag gi sems pa med pa bdag nyid du 'dod pa de dag gnyis ka yang sems las ma gtogs pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mu stegs grangs can pas bdag sems pa yod pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa dang / bye brag gi sems pa med pa bdag nyid du 'dod pa de dag gnyis ka yang sems las ma gtogs pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, both the tīrthikas who assert that the self is the mind and the Vaibhāṣikas who assert that the self is not the mind accept that the self is not different from the mind.🔽

original: bdag nyid yin par mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i don du sems 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid yin par mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i don du sems 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that both the Sāṃkhya tīrthikas, who assert the self to be the nature of consciousness, and the Vaiśeṣikas, who assert the self to be the nature of unconsciousness, are untenable because they accept the self to be nothing other than the mind, the root text says, “This mind itself . . .”

original: da ni bdag grub tu zin kyang rtag pa nyid kyis na las dang 'bras bu ji ltar yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bdag grub tu zin kyang rtag pa nyid kyis na las dang 'bras bu ji ltar yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that, even if the self were established, it would be untenable for karma and its results to exist because the self is permanent, the root text says,

original: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “The body and so on . . .”

original: bdag med kyang dngos po mi rtag pa la las dang 'bras bu mi 'gal bar phyi rol dang nang gi dpe gnyis kyis /
analyzed: bdag med kyang dngos po mi rtag pa la las dang 'bras bu mi 'gal bar phyi rol dang nang gi dpe gnyis kyis /
translated: Even though there is no self, it is not contradictory for karma and its results to exist in impermanent things. In order to demonstrate this, the root text uses two examples, one external and one internal.

original: go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir sa bon la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / byis pa'i lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir sa bon la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / byis pa'i lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, respectively, the root text says, “A seed . . .” and “The body of a child . . .”

original: da ni lus la sogs pa mi rtag pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lus la sogs pa mi rtag pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the body and so forth are impermanent,

original: mngal na gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mngal na gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Dwelling in the womb,” and so forth.

original: de ltar mi rtag par gyur ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag par gyur ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the manner in which they are impermanent,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “For example,” and so forth.

original: de ltar ni ma grub kyi so so'i rgyud las skye zhing 'jig par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma grub kyi so so'i rgyud las skye zhing 'jig par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is not established, so in order to demonstrate that they arise and perish in each continuum,

original: de ltar sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “In that way, sentient beings,” and so forth.

original: sems can med kyang snying rje bya ba mi 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can med kyang snying rje bya ba mi 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not contradictory to practice compassion even though sentient beings do not exist,

original: gal te sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Even though sentient beings,” and so forth.

original: dgos pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tha snyad gdags pa sla ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgos pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tha snyad gdags pa sla ba'i phyir te /
translated: “For the sake of a purpose” and so forth is because it is easy to impute a convention.

original: skyes bu lha sbyin zhes bya bar tha snyad ma btags par gzugs dang / tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha snyad gdags dka' ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bu lha sbyin zhes bya bar tha snyad ma btags par gzugs dang / tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha snyad gdags dka' ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is difficult to designate it by the name of form, feeling and so on, because it is difficult to designate it by the name of a person called Devadatta, and because it is in harmony with the world.

original: 'jig rten la yang gang zag ces bya ba la sogs par grags kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos tsam du ma grags pa'i phyir dang / lung dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten la yang gang zag ces bya ba la sogs par grags kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos tsam du ma grags pa'i phyir dang / lung dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is in harmony with the world because the world is renowned for the term person and so on, but it is not renowned for the mere phenomena of form and so on, and because it is in harmony with scripture.🔽For scripture declares:🔽This person or sentient being is the six elements and so on, but it does not declare:

original: lung las kyang skyes bu gang zag 'di ni khams drug par zhes bya ba la sogs par gsungs kyi gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma gsungs pa'i phyir dang / skyon dang / @347a * //
analyzed: lung las kyang skyes bu gang zag 'di ni khams drug par zhes bya ba la sogs par gsungs kyi gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma gsungs pa'i phyir dang / skyon dang / @347a * //
translated: This is form and so on.

original: yon tan tshad gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yon tan tshad gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is in order to measure faults and qualities.

original: skyes bu gang zag ces bya bar btags na de'i skyon la sogs pa tshad zin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag ces bya bar btags na de'i skyon la sogs pa tshad zin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is designated as a person or sentient being, its faults and so on can be measured.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni skyon 'di tsam dang ldan no zhes bya ba brjod na de'i tshad zin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni skyon 'di tsam dang ldan no zhes bya ba brjod na de'i tshad zin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: If you say, “Form and so on have only these faults,” you will not be able to measure them.

original: / ji ltar khyed la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / ji ltar khyed la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “just as for you,”

original: khyed kyi sems can dang zhes bya ba la sogs par brtags nas /
analyzed: khyed kyi sems can dang zhes bya ba la sogs par brtags nas /
translated: after you have investigated “sentient beings” and so on,

original: de snying rje skye ba bzhin du kho bo cag gi gzhung gis gong du bstan pa bzhin du dgos pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang gis sems can zhes bya ba btags nas snying rje bya bar 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de snying rje skye ba bzhin du kho bo cag gi gzhung gis gong du bstan pa bzhin du dgos pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang gis sems can zhes bya ba btags nas snying rje bya bar 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: just as compassion arises, in the same way, in our scriptures, after you have imputed “sentient beings” by the power of the four requirements, as was taught above, there is no contradiction in having compassion. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis bdag ces bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis bdag ces bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the nonestablishment of the so-called self in the manner that was explained,

original: stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas 'jigs pa yang med la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas 'jigs pa yang med la /
translated: there is no fear from meditating on emptiness.

original: de ni bcings pa yang med cing grol bar bya ba'i phyir dag pa la brtson par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni bcings pa yang med cing grol bar bya ba'i phyir dag pa la brtson par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: And since there is no bondage, it is not the case that you must strive for purification in order to be liberated.

original: bdag ma grub kyang bdag tu gzung ba'i gzhi'i sems de bcings pa las grol bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: bdag ma grub kyang bdag tu gzung ba'i gzhi'i sems de bcings pa las grol bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the statement that, although the self does not exist, one should strive for virtue in order to liberate the mind, the basis for the apprehension of self, from bondage,

original: ji ltar chu shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar chu shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Just as with a plantain tree,” and so on.

original: 'on te stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor de ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor de ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: But how should one cultivate that yoga of emptiness?

original: de bsgom pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽lus ni rkang pa phyin pa min //
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir / lus ni rkang pa phyin pa min //
translated: In order to demonstrate the stages of cultivating that,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “The body is not the feet,” and so on.

original: thog mar so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gtan la phab nas /
analyzed: thog mar so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gtan la phab nas /
translated: First, one should ascertain the meaning of emptiness just as it is with discerning wisdom.

original: de'i rjes la gtan la phab pa'i don bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i rim pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la gtan la phab pa'i don bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i rim pa yin no //
translated: Then, the stages of cultivation are the cultivation of the meaning that has been ascertained.

original: de ltar ma byas na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
translated: If one does not do it that way, what is the fault?

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the characteristics of entities have not been ascertained,

original: de bsgom pa la 'jug par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bsgom pa la 'jug par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: one will not engage in the cultivation of that.

original: zhugs kyang the tshom za bar yang 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: zhugs kyang the tshom za bar yang 'gyur zhing /
translated: Even if they do, they will have doubts.

original: de ni sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: And it will not be the antidote that eliminates the obscurations.🔽As the noble King of Samādhi Sūtra says,

original: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las ting nge 'dzin de ni bsgom pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las ting nge 'dzin de ni bsgom pa med mod kyi /
translated: That samādhi is not meditation,

original: de ni bdag tu 'du shes 'jig mi byed //
analyzed: de ni bdag tu 'du shes 'jig mi byed //
translated: but it does not destroy the perception of a self.

original: de ni nyon mongs phyir zhing rab 'khrugs te //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs phyir zhing rab 'khrugs te //
translated: It is disturbed by the afflictions again and again,

original: lhag spyod 'dir ni ting 'dzin bsgom pa bzhin //🔽zhes gsungs @347b pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lhag spyod 'dir ni ting 'dzin bsgom pa bzhin // zhes gsungs @347b pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the meditation on samādhi by Udraka.

original: 'on te so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis gtan la phab nas bsgoms na de'i tshe cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis gtan la phab nas bsgoms na de'i tshe cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if you meditate after determining things with discerning wisdom, what will happen then?

original: thog mar bsgom pa la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: thog mar bsgom pa la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: To begin with, you will enter into meditation.

original: zhugs nas the tshom mi za bar yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhugs nas the tshom mi za bar yang 'gyur la /
translated: And once you have entered, you will not have doubts.

original: sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por 'gyur ba'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por 'gyur ba'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: And it will be the cause of nirvāṇa because it will be the antidote that eliminates the obscurations.

original: ji skad du mdo sde nyid las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde nyid las /
translated: As the sūtras themselves say,

original: gal te chos la bdag med so sor rtog / so sor de brtags gal te bsgom pa ni //
analyzed: gal te chos la bdag med so sor rtog / so sor de brtags gal te bsgom pa ni //
translated: and if one meditates on that analysis,

original: de ni mya ngan 'bras thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan 'bras thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
translated: that is the cause of the result of attaining nirvana.

original: rgyu gzhan gang yin de ni zhir mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang yin de ni zhir mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Any other cause will not lead to peace.

original: gal te de ltar yin na de'i tshe gang la ji ltar brtag par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na de'i tshe gang la ji ltar brtag par bya snyam pa la /
translated: If that is so, then with respect to what should one analyze what?

original: rgyal ba byams pas dbus mtha' las phyin ci log bzhi spang ba dang / bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyal ba byams pas dbus mtha' las phyin ci log bzhi spang ba dang / bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: The Victor Maitreya, in the Madhyantavibhanga, says that in order to abandon the four errors and to enter into the four noble truths,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom zhes gsungs pas /
translated: one should cultivate the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang chos la brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang chos la brtag par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should analyze the body, feelings, the mind, and phenomena.

original: de la dang po lus la brtag pa'i dbang du byas nas lus ni dbang po zhes bya bas ni lus zhes bya ba ste rkang pa la sogs pa de nyid kyi ma yin la gzhan na yang med par bstan te /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la dang po lus la brtag pa'i dbang du byas nas lus ni dbang po zhes bya bas ni lus zhes bya ba ste rkang pa la sogs pa de nyid kyi ma yin la gzhan na yang med par bstan te /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: With regard to that, first, from the perspective of analyzing the body, the line “The body is not the faculties” teaches that the so-called body is not the feet and so on, nor is it something other than them.

original: rkang pa la sogs pa de dag ni tha dad pas /
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa de dag ni tha dad pas /
translated: because they are different,

original: dus ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de nas logs shig na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de nas logs shig na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because they are not at the time, and because they are not perceived separately from the observed parts.

original: da ni lus zhes bya ba de yan lag rnams la cha shas kyi sa gnas sam bdag nyid thams cad kyis gnas brtag ste /
analyzed: da ni lus zhes bya ba de yan lag rnams la cha shas kyi sa gnas sam bdag nyid thams cad kyis gnas brtag ste /
translated: Now, one should investigate whether the so-called body is located in the parts by way of a portion or by way of the whole.

original: de la phyogs dang po'i dbang du byas nas cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po'i dbang du byas nas cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate that the consequence is that it has parts if it is in the first way,

original: gal te lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If this body is located in the foot, etc.”

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar yin na ni /🔽lus de nyid du mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar yin na ni / lus de nyid du mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is in the second way,🔽the consequence is that the body is multiple.

original: lus ni lag sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lus ni lag sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, “The body is not in the foot, etc.”🔽Now, in order to demonstrate that the body is not located in the foot, etc.,

original: da ni lag pa la sogs pa'i nad dang phyi rol na yang med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lag pa la sogs pa'i nad dang phyi rol na yang med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and also not outside,🔽he says,

original: lus ni lag sogs nang na gnas //
analyzed: lus ni lag sogs nang na gnas //
translated: The body is not present within the hands and so on.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The body is not located in the limbs, etc.

original: cha shas med pa zhes bya ba ni lus gcig gi mtshan nyid de'o //🔽cha can gyi nang du @348a * //🔽'jug par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cha shas med pa zhes bya ba ni lus gcig gi mtshan nyid de'o // cha can gyi nang du @348a * // 'jug par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, “partless” means the characteristic of a single body.🔽“ Located in the parts” means

original: yan lag du ma'i nang du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag du ma'i nang du 'jug pa ste /
translated: located in the many parts.

original: lus ni gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus ni gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the body is one,

original: yan lag du ma'i nang du 'jug par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag du ma'i nang du 'jug par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is not possible for it to be located in the many parts.

original: 'on te de ltar lus med par lus kyi blo ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar lus med par lus kyi blo ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la /
translated: But if the body does not exist, how does the idea of a body arise?

original: de bas lus med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas lus med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “The body does not exist, etc.”

original: da ni yan lag rnams kyang ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yan lag rnams kyang ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the parts are not established, it says,

original: de bzhin sor mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin sor mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Likewise, the fingers, etc.”

original: da ni rdul phra rab ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdul phra rab ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the subtle atom is not established, it says,

original: phyogs cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyogs cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The direction-part, etc.”

original: cha med par zhes bya ba ni cha shas kyis gzhigs na med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cha med par zhes bya ba ni cha shas kyis gzhigs na med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Partless” means that it does not exist when it is broken down into parts.

original: da ni rdul phra rab bsags pa ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdul phra rab bsags pa ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the non-establishment of the aggregation of subtle atoms, he says:

original: rdul rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rdul rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “The atoms” and so on.

original: de ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the method of cultivating the mindfulness of the body,

original: da ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the benefits of cultivation,

original: de ltar brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “When one thus investigates” and so on.

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The afflictions such as attachment and aversion are abandoned. This is the meaning.

original: da ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, in terms of the method of cultivating the mindfulness of feelings,

original: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'dis ni yul myong bar byed pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dis ni yul myong bar byed pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: he says, “The mind” and so on.🔽This demonstrates the untenability of the experience of objects.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyams su myong bar byed pa nyid mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyams su myong bar byed pa nyid mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: “By itself” demonstrates the untenability of the experience of intrinsic nature.

original: gzhan gyis kyang de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni myong bar byed pa nyid du mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni myong bar byed pa nyid du mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “nor is it tenable that it is experienced by another” and so on teaches that it is not tenable that it is experienced by itself.

original: de ltar tshor ba bdag ces bya ba myong ba'i ngo bo yin la /🔽de ni myong bar byed pa dang myong bar bya ba dang gnyis las /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba bdag ces bya ba myong ba'i ngo bo yin la / de ni myong bar byed pa dang myong bar bya ba dang gnyis las /
translated: Thus, the self that is called “feeling” has the nature of experience.🔽It is not tenable that it is both the experiencer and the experienced.

original: gnyi ga mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: gnyi ga mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: This is how it should be understood that it is not tenable that it is both.

original: da ni de ltar bsgom pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni de ltar bsgom pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the benefits of such meditation, the text says, “Thus, when one meditates on the absence of self in feelings,” and so on.

original: tshor ba ni sred pa skyed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can yin la /🔽de ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba rang bzhin med par shes pas phra ba'am bral ba'am /
analyzed: tshor ba ni sred pa skyed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can yin la / de ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba rang bzhin med par shes pas phra ba'am bral ba'am /
translated: The function of feeling is to serve as the basis for the generation of craving.

original: rmongs pa'i sred pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i sred pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, by knowing that feelings such as pleasure are essenceless, the subtle craving for pleasure, separation from pain, and the ignorance of thinking that they are real will not arise. This is the meaning.

original: @348b da ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @348b da ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the method of meditating on the close placement of mindfulness on the mind,

original: yid ni dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yid ni dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the text says, “The mind is the basis of the faculties,” and so on.

original: 'dis ni dbang po la sogs pa de dag la yid ces bya ba de gzung du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po la sogs pa de dag la yid ces bya ba de gzung du med pa'i phyir /
translated: This verse shows that the so-called mind is not apprehended in those faculties and so on.

original: mi gnas par rang bzhin med par ston to /
analyzed: mi gnas par rang bzhin med par ston to /
translated: This shows that since that so-called mind is not apprehended in those faculties and so on, it does not exist inherently.

original: sems can zhes bya ba ni sems kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba ni sems kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Sentient beings means “of the mind.”

original: da ni ma skyes pas rang bzhin med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ma skyes pas rang bzhin med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that because it is not arisen, it does not exist inherently,

original: shes byas ni shes bya la sogs pa smos te /🔽ci'i phyir shes bya dus mnyam pa la dmigs te /
analyzed: shes byas ni shes bya la sogs pa smos te / ci'i phyir shes bya dus mnyam pa la dmigs te /
translated: the object of knowledge and so on are mentioned.

original: skyer mi rung snyam pa la /
analyzed: skyer mi rung snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it not tenable to observe an object of knowledge that is simultaneous with it?

original: shes bya'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes bya'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, it might be argued that the object of knowledge and the consciousness are simultaneous.

original: shes bya dus mnyam pa yod pa'i dus na shes pa de yod na /
analyzed: shes bya dus mnyam pa yod pa'i dus na shes pa de yod na /
translated: If the object of knowledge exists at the time of the object of knowledge and the consciousness exists at that time,

original: shes bya dus mnyam pa de shes pa de la phan ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya dus mnyam pa de shes pa de la phan ci zhig bya ste /
translated: what benefit is there in the object of knowledge that is simultaneous with the consciousness to the consciousness?

original: shes pa ma skyes pa'i dus na ni shes bya nyid kyang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa ma skyes pa'i dus na ni shes bya nyid kyang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because at the time when the consciousness has not arisen, the object of knowledge does not exist.

original: gang gi phan byed gang gi tshe shes bya skyes pa'i dus de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: gang gi phan byed gang gi tshe shes bya skyes pa'i dus de'i tshe na ni /
translated: What benefits what?

original: shes pa nyid kyang skye bas phan bya mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyang skye bas phan bya mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness itself does not need to be benefited by arising.

original: 'on te gang las kyang ma skyes kyang rang bzhin gyis gnas so snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te gang las kyang ma skyes kyang rang bzhin gyis gnas so snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it endures by its intrinsic nature, even though it does not arise from anywhere,

original: rang gi gnas pa 'gal med de //
analyzed: rang gi gnas pa 'gal med de //
translated: then its endurance would be without contradiction.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would be without cause.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the example is like a sky flower.

original: da ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, from the perspective of cultivating the application of mindfulness to phenomena,

original: rkyen rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “Conditions” and so on.

original: rkyen so so ba las mi skye ste /
analyzed: rkyen so so ba las mi skye ste /
translated: It does not arise from individual conditions,

original: sa bon la sogs re re las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs re re las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not arise from each individual thing, such as a seed.

original: 'dus pa las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: It also does not arise from a collection,

original: gang las mi skye ba de dag nyid 'dus phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las mi skye ba de dag nyid 'dus phyir ro //
translated: because that which does not arise from each individual thing does not arise from their collection.

original: 'o na gnyis po de las gzhan pa las skyes sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gnyis po de las gzhan pa las skyes sam zhe na /
translated: Well, does it arise from something other than those two?

original: gzhan nas 'ongs pa ma yin la //
analyzed: gzhan nas 'ongs pa ma yin la //
translated: It does not come from another.

original: de ltar ma skyes pa yi phyir //
analyzed: de ltar ma skyes pa yi phyir //
translated: Because it does not arise in that way,

original: gnas pa med la 'gro ba med //
analyzed: gnas pa med la 'gro ba med //
translated: it does not endure and it does not go.

original: ces smras so //
analyzed: ces smras so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'o na 'jig rten pa rnams kyis ji ste bden par rtogs snyam pa la /🔽de ni 'khrul nas brtags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten pa rnams kyis ji ste bden par rtogs snyam pa la / de ni 'khrul nas brtags pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, if one thinks, “How is it that worldly people understand it to be true?”🔽[The root text] states, “Because it is imagined through delusion,”

original: sgyu ma dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: da ni dngos po rnams la don dam par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos po rnams la don dam par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that ultimately things are free from going and coming,

original: sgyu mas sprul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgyu mas sprul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: [the root text] states, “An emanated being conjured by a magician,” and so on.

original: da ni dngos po rnams yod pa dang med pa gang yang ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos po rnams yod pa dang med pa gang yang ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that since things are not produced as either existent or nonexistent,

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /🔽dngos po yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas / dngos po yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: they have the characteristic of nonexistence,🔽and therefore do not exist as things,

original: dngos po yod par 'gyur ba @349a * //
analyzed: dngos po yod par 'gyur ba @349a * //
translated: [the root text] states, “If things existed as things,”

original: la ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: la ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'o na gnyi ga yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na gnyi ga yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Now, if one thinks that both [exist and do not exist],

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: [the root text] states, “If things existed through their intrinsic nature,” and so on.

original: da ni mtshan gzhi ma grub pas de'i mtshan nyid ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni mtshan gzhi ma grub pas de'i mtshan nyid ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the characteristic is not established because the basis of characteristics is not established, he says “likewise” and so on.

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to summarize, he says “therefore” and so on.

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: As for “dream” and so on,

original: don dam par med kyang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par med kyang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: although they do not exist ultimately, they appear.

original: snying po med ces bya ba ni brtags nas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽da ni de ltar brtags pa'i phan yon 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la zhen pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying po med ces bya ba ni brtags nas ma grub pa'i phyir ro // da ni de ltar brtags pa'i phan yon 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la zhen pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: As for “without essence,” this is because they are not established when investigated.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the benefit of such an investigation, the freedom from attachment to the eight worldly concerns, he says “thus” and so on.

original: yan lag gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the branches is easy to understand.

original: da ni dngos por zhen pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal la bde bar gnas par phyin ci log pa dag la gnyen po stong pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos por zhen pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal la bde bar gnas par phyin ci log pa dag la gnyen po stong pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach emptiness as the antidote for those who, due to the power of clinging to things, are mistaken in their belief that suffering is happiness, he says “the emptiness of the internal” and so on.

original: rang nyid grol bar bya ba'i thabs la 'bad par bya'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang nyid grol bar bya ba'i thabs la 'bad par bya'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that one should strive for the means of liberating oneself is stated🔽in the verse beginning,🔽Those who desire happiness for themselves

original: bdag nyid bde bar 'dod rnams ni //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid bde bar 'dod rnams ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Those who desire happiness for themselves🔽and so on.

original: yan lag gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The subsidiary meaning is easy to understand.

original: bstan bcos kyi ming gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽shes rab bstan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi ming gi don ni snga ma bzhin no // shes rab bstan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the treatise's name is as before.🔽This is the commentary on the eighth chapter, having twenty-one verses, called

original: le'u brgyad pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u brgyad pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / da ni las 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni las 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to make karma have a result,🔽in order to dedicate the roots of virtue and to pay homage to one's spiritual

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba dang / rang gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la drin du gzo ba'i sgo nas phyag 'tshal ba'i phyir le'u dgu pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba dang / rang gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la drin du gzo ba'i sgo nas phyag 'tshal ba'i phyir le'u dgu pa gsungs te /
translated: friend out of gratitude, chapter 9 is presented.🔽The dedication of the roots of virtue in order to make karma have a result🔽is taught in the verse beginning,

original: bdag gis byang chub spyod pa la //
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub spyod pa la //
translated: Having generated the enlightened spirit,

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and ending with,

original: ston pa bzhin du mchod byed shog / ces bya ba'i bar gyis las 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba bstan to //
analyzed: ston pa bzhin du mchod byed shog / ces bya ba'i bar gyis las 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba bstan to //
translated: May I worship the Teacher.

original: bstan pa rnyed dang zhes bya ba tshig gnyis kyis bstan pa yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba bstan to //🔽gang gi drin gyis dge blo 'byung //
analyzed: bstan pa rnyed dang zhes bya ba tshig gnyis kyis bstan pa yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba bstan to // gang gi drin gyis dge blo 'byung //
translated: The two lines beginning “I dedicate this virtue to the teachings” show the dedication for the sake of the teachings remaining for a long time.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis drin gzo ba'i sgo nas rang gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la phyag 'tshal ba bstan te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis drin gzo ba'i sgo nas rang gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la phyag 'tshal ba bstan te //
translated: The one verse beginning “Through whose kindness the thought of virtue arises” shows the homage to his own spiritual master in terms of repaying his kindness.

original: bstan bcos kyi ming gi don ni le'u dang por bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi ming gi don ni le'u dang por bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the name of the treatise is as explained in the first chapter.

original: yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya ba ste le'u dgu pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya ba ste le'u dgu pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the ninth chapter of the Bodhicharyavatara, the chapter on dedication.

original: // / de dag gi yan lag gi don shin tu go sla ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: // / de dag gi yan lag gi don shin tu go sla ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The meaning of the words of the root text is very easy to understand, so I have not commented on it.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'i dka' 'grel rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'i dka' 'grel rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the Bodhicharyavatara.
